Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: HolidayDH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Orchard recently and had a great time. The hotel is central to a shopping haven. Rooms are extremely comfortable. Was a weekend holiday to the universal studios . My two kids age 7 and 9 loved the room and we slept comfortably on the king sized bed. The swimming pool has a restaurant next to it, clean and great place for the children. The service is top notch, all requests over the phone were made within 3-5 minutes. The reception and the attendant were all helpful. Internet is free , all you gotto do is sign up as a Marriott member.

Reviews.Title: “my stay”
Reviews.Author: imranahmed61
Reviews.Content: Marriot Singapore after renovation is great. Service was always legendary but rooms looked aged a year ago. The club lounge is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Marriott: Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave801_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Singapore 17th to 19th April 2012 in room 2704 on a business trip. Excellent hotel, very well placed on corner of Orchard Road. Excellent facilities, very welcoming staff and very high service standards. Great room and very well appointed very modern and comfortable. Restaurants were very good and overall its a top class hotel I would recommend. I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt Singapore and the Marriott is far superior. The only negative is that room 2704 had noise ingress from the lifts. I would ask for a room 2708 and higher on this floor

Reviews.Title: “Great room service food, average rooms, bad taxi wait time”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyLion
Reviews.Content: Rooms are modern and feels new. Not a very good business hotel - expect to wait 20-30 minutes to get a cab from the hotel in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jasperjugan
Reviews.Content: best hotel so far I've stayed in Singapore. very luxurious and comfortable, staff were extra courteous and polite and they go out of the way to treat guests. I was staying here for a non-revenue points redemption and when they knew it was our anniversary, they sent wine and chocolates in our room for greeting. they even offered to have a baby crib for our infant which is a nice gesture. room view is good (looking towards orchard intersection) and very accessible since it is just above Orchard Station of SMRT. also bought a pass that picked us up straight from the hotel backdoor to Sentosa. it is also adjacent to Tang's and a lot of shopping malls are nearby. room is spacious and comfortable and our child love their bath tub. amenities is standard but upscale. would definitely want to stay here again if i'm in the area and if budget permits as I understand the hotel may be pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Rowe
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay here in 5 years. I've told many people that this was one of the best hotels I had stayed at anywhere in the world. Well, my friends, it has only gotten better! Newly remodeled rooms are richly appointed, very accommodating (small touches like the international electrical outlets) and are squeaky clean. Their Breakfast buffet in the lobby is outstanding and not to be missed! They have the friendliest staff in any Hotel I've stayed at anywhere. The Executive Lounge is busy during Happy hour ( 530 to 730) though I’ve always found a seat. Free drinks served by as many as 5 wait staff is a great touch and an improvement over self-serve IMHO. Prices for the rooms are a bit high, though I did a thorough comparison to other hotels in the area and they are on par with current market prices. This is a fantastic property. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Fayyaz S
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but very bad rooms and other facilities. Even there was no attendant at the swimming pool for the services. If u need locker, you got to go a level down and comeback and again go down to return the key

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, location, can be expensive, but worth it....”
Reviews.Author: IrelandWildRover
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at this hotel, mainly on business but this trip was a treat for my wife and son to do some shopping and sightseeing in Singapore. We live in Thailand so its not too far to go for a weekend. I was coming from Jakarta to join my family, who were arriving earlier than me. They were able to check in without having to give any form of guarantee, which was very accommodating of the hotel, and we had also been upgraded to a suite..one of the newly refurbished ones...so the weekend was off to a good start! As previous reveiwers have said, this is an old hotel, built in traditional Chinese style, as an octagon because the number 8 is considered very lucky in Chinese culture, so good Fung Shui! Before it became a Marriott it was called the Tang Dynasty Hotel and it is "attached" to Tangs Department Store next door. The hotel has been tastefully upgraded over the past twelve months and, while you cannot change the fundamental size of the rooms, the upgrade has been very cleverly designed to maximise the use of the available space. At the time of writing this review all but the lobby entrance had been upgraded. The major plus point for this hotel is its location, right on the corner of Orchard and Scotts Road, great for shopping and entertainment, good restaurants, and more. Its also only a short cab ride from great places like Clarke Quay and Boat Quay...but then everything in Singapore is only a short cab ride from anywhere!! The Crossroads cafe is THE best location for evening cocktails and dinner, outside, watching the world go by. There is always a great buzz about this restaurant and it offers both indoor (air con) and outdoor seating. This is also where they serve the breakfast buffet which, as other reviewers have said, is just awesome!! They have a new fruit smoothie every day and they are delicious. Oh, and they are putting new Samsung 44" Smart TVs in all the bedrooms...for you TV techno buffs out there...amazing picture quality. For fitness buffs, the pool is lovely, and the Health club has a great range of equipment and the massage, while expensive, is also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: lithlith
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights in March 2012. We took a cab from the airport to the Marriott that cost 29.90 Singapore dollars. We gave the driver 32 and you would have thought we were his new best friends! We arrived at the Singapore Marriott at 3am. We were surprised to find 3 people working the desk at this hour! Because of Marriott status level we were upgraded to a room on the 30th floor with a great view of the city and Orchard Road. The only downside was that the room was small. There was a hairdryer, safe, iron, and ironing board. There were 2 free bottles of water in the room. The bathroom was large with sink, toilet and shower all in one room. Because of my husband has status with Marriott, we had access to the Executive Lounge. The lounge opens at 6am each morning and is very large with lots of seating. In the lounge there is Pepsi, coffee, tea, bottled water, snacks, and fruit. At 5:30pm each evening, there is food out in the lounge and is enough to make a meal out of if you are not a picky eater. For breakfast we could either eat in the lounge, which had a lot of choices or in the restaurant downstairs. We ate in the restaurant both days we stayed there. This is by far the best breakfast buffet we have ever seen anywhere in the world. There were many choices of juices, lots of different fruits, Asian food, waffles, breads, pancakes, bacon, ham, sausages, cheeses, cut cuts, steak, rice, cereals, eggs, and even several kinds of ice cream! There is access to the MRT right outside the hotel. There are also several malls within a 2 minute walk out of the hotel. We took a cab to the cruise ship terminal for around 10 Singapore dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Evita29
Reviews.Content: Old hotel,now is under construction also sometimes little noisy. The location is excellnet,when you want shopping. But the best thing in this hotel is the breakfast! I have never seen so excellnet breakfast buffet in my life-everything you want is there-also steaks, seafood, for children ice cream, many kinds of bakery products, fruit and vegetable, they also make for you espresso coffee or capuccino......

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel, worth the price - perhaps not?”
Reviews.Author: RochelleM
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Singapore in Orchard rd is a wonderful luxury hotel. The service I experienced on my second visit to this hotel was 100% better than my previous visit, which just goes to show that it is still up to the individual you end up dealing with. The hotel has all the creature comforts and is very well located. The restaurants are not wonderful which is a gap in a hotel on this level. The basic rooms are very good but as soon as you begin to upgrade, the quality becomes markedly better, of course for a markedly improved price. I cannot find fault with anything this hotel offers and in fact I would recommend it, but for the price, they could pay greater attention to detail and improve some of the smaller things.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Babu P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at great location. Everything is very reachable but you dont feel that problem in singapore. Compared to other marriott hotels, singapore Marriot might appear small but space is really a big constraint in Singapore. So, this is probably the best hotel in Singapore. The staff is courteous; the breakfast is amazing. the stay has been as comfortable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice city hotel for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Yu_Ching1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott hotel in Singapore over a weekend in February, to enjoy the shopping and nightlife of Orchard Road. The newly renovated pool terrace rooms were very nice indeed, located on the 5th floor of the hotel. They opened directly to the pool area, which is lovely. Wide open lap pool, with some cabanas and lots of deck chairs and sun-loungers. Laid-back, relaxing atmosphere, despite the bustle of Orchard Road just below. The Pool Grill which was adjacent to it serves lunch and dinner, and the setting is lovely; looking out on the pool. Pity they are not open for breakfast, because it would make it a perfect place to start the day. However, order room-service breakfast is available for Pool Terrace guests, and is part of the room rate. You can enjoy it on the small terrace area just outside your room. Room furnishings and bathroom very high standard. Deep bathtub and separate rain shower, all in cool, grey granite stone. Unfortunately, the sound insulation of the room is not very good. We could hear our neighbour's TV late into the night, and also the sounds of children screaming in the pool in the morning - woke us up at 8 am ! Hopefully, the hotel will improve on sound-proofing the rooms. The rest of the hotel is undergoing renovations now, but from what we could see, the lobby area and restaurants look very modern and contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Effortless Stay”
Reviews.Author: NEProp
Reviews.Content: I am a repeat customer of this hotel location and I was upgraded to one of the newly refurbished suites - they are large and well appointed. Told that approx 80% of the rooms have been updated and there is still constuction to complete the balance. The front entrance way is under construction but told that it will be done and re-open in April. I have access to the executive lounge and the dinners are very nice with great views overlooking the city. One can have breakfast in this lounge too, but the better choice is the main cafe on the lobby floor - the range and quality of food is hard to describe but it has everything one could ever want from donuts and icecream to omlets to fruit, cereal, breads, teas, coffees etc. The only downside is that there is still construction going on around the 5th floor and it can be REALLY loud which makes dining by the pool grill a non-starter. Gym / spa is still excellent with everything that you need. Basketball court due to be updated in April. There is also construction on Orchard Road so if your room is on this side then you should ask for a high floor so that it is not too noisy. Staff is excellent at this property. Only place I'll stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PCD63
Reviews.Content: On the crossing of Orchard and Scott Road you can find the Marriott. While this location is a bit out of the business center (CBD), you can easily hop on the MRT (subway) to get to the center. Of course you have easy access to the shopping at Orchard road. Recently the rooms have been remodeled. The new lay-out for the bath room and the bed room are a big improvement but the overall dimensions of the room remain limited. What makes this Marriott so special? The hospitality of the hotel staff and the outstanding food! A return to the Singapore Marriott feels like a home coming.

Reviews.Title: “Great Orchard Road Location”
Reviews.Author: BPreston310
Reviews.Content: This is the only Marriott property in Singapore. So, if you are chasing those Marriott points this is your only option. The property is perfectly located on Orchard Road (one of the major shopping and restaurant areas) and very easy access to MRT. Of worthwhile mention, the Orchard Road MRT station is one of the very few stations you can obtain a tourist pass. I have stayed at this location several times and have never had any problems with the property. There is a lot of noise on Orchard and there seems to be construction going on at all hours. Nothing the hotel can control. Just something to be aware of. As of end of March, there is major work going on at the hotel. There is a remodel in progress. I did NOT have any issues with this during my stay. This is Singapore, so I would recommend venturing out rather than using the hotels bars and restaurants. There is just too may options so why confine yourself to the Marriott. If you have to stay in, there's great room service and many options for dining. I did stop for a night cap at the outdoor bar and was happy I didn't' miss $18.00 beer night. That is not a typo. Very high price for beer even in Singapore. The bartender and staff were however very professional and pleasant. In conclusion, great hotel and I would recommend for anyone that wants a great hotel and Marriott points. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “pool level suite”
Reviews.Author: tommys1947
Reviews.Content: wife and i stayed at this hotel after a cruise pool level suite was excellent service was quite good in the hotel, but the street level restaurant was understaffed still, i'd go back

Reviews.Title: “Renovations paying off”
Reviews.Author: Rajeev N
Reviews.Content: i had a night in Marriott Singapore, and had one of the newly renovated rooms. what took me was the size of the rooms in this hotel and how they have catered for every need of the business traveler. Clean and neat the bathrooms have been renovated to meet the modern standards too. The service is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “First time at a Marriott and wasn't disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JWGT1957
Reviews.Content: My first time staying at a Marriott and I have to admit I was impressed. Location is great with Orchard road right there. Executive room is a real must if you're visiting for business and the club lounge is excellent. I couldn't fault the room or the service. The Marriott isn't new and it certainly has benefited from the renovations which understandably may have annoyed some but its a minor issue really. Its a really excellent hotel with a location that makes it an even more attractive choice for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean lines in new renovations”
Reviews.Author: Tracy C
Reviews.Content: We always stay at this hotel when in Singapore. They have recently undergone renovations and we have since stayed in both a regular room and a room they called a studio. Both rooms have been nicely updated with modern furniture and clean lines. The bathroom is chic with a great huge shower. There is no longer a tub, but I loved the spacious shower. The room they called a studio was actually just a slightly larger room with a small partition built to separate a tiny desk from the bed area. The plan in the new rooms maximizes the space better than the old rooms did. Nice job. The renovations are not quite done, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just in the hearth of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Luke991
Reviews.Content: I visited this Hotel during my last stay in Singapore early March 2012 and overall I can say that I had a very nice stay. The lobby is still under renovation thus it gives a bit of inconvenience to the guest and visitors. The rooms I stayed in, probably has been just renovated and still a bit smelly of fresh paint or cement which was not really pleasant. The rest of the facilities are quite nice with an excellent buffet restaurant! If you must stay in Orchard Area that the Hotel for you!! I would like also to express my gratitude to the Concierge Team for having helped me to get back my HP which I have lost in a cab!! Great Job Guys!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Firies1976
Reviews.Content: My husband had to travel to Singapore for business and I tagged along. What made this hotel special was the staff. The room was very nice, certainly clean, bathroom great, but the staff was excellent. Each and every person I spoke to was helpful, knowledgeable and polite. They were obviously well trained and truly seemed to want our trip to be memorable. The breakfast buffet was fantastic and had a great mix of local and Western food. I hope we get a chance to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Free Does not make it Good”
Reviews.Author: Radarman123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel using Marriott Points. This was the last stop off of a 35 day cruise. Check was great and so was the service. What really bugged me was the food quality of the hotel. Rooms -- rooms at this hotel have been always small. Hotel was under renovation and it was very noisy. The lounge was no excuse. First off it was crowded -- you could not get a seat (not acceptable). Third the food was bad and the dessert bar was none. The buffet restaurant is a local favorite. Maybe because for one price there is lobster, oysters and prawns. None of this was eatable. The oysters were definitely not fresh and that slimy taste. Cost per person on the buffet is $75 USD. A rip-off and guests should stay away and eat out. We ere tired (no excuse) and decided to eat-in.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but a great Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M
Reviews.Content: Food was a bit expensive but it was good. Location worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: xtnas99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night stay only, but love it so much, as location for sure is well-known, Orchard, and access to Orchard MRT station is very easy, there are two closeby access to the MRT, in front of the hotel, and on the right side (in front of Crossroad cafe). Currently they are having a renovation in lobby section but not too troublesome as you will be directed to the back entrance, and you may walk-thru the crossroad cafe to MRT station. Bus stop can be found easily along the Orchard road. Room is in normal size, not too big but convinience for 3 persons in a room. You can request your room preferences upon booking, and 2-3 days before check in they will send an email reconfirming your preferences, which you can modify & reconfirmed. For sure I recommend this hotel, and would love to stay back again.

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing hotel we ever stayed in - and the breakfast needs to seen to be believed.”
Reviews.Author: adriankenworthy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. Upon arrival it was noted that I was a Marriott rewards holder (although only a basic points one) and was offered an upgrade to a top floor room with VIP lounge access for S$120.00 per night. I accepted this offer - and what a great decision. The room had been upgraded earlier this year so everything was brand new and the bed was huge. Breakfast time involved the head chef going round and rejecting some items as they were not up to his standard (they looked fine to us). We went back to this hotel just for a meal again - utterly amazing. Would stay here for much longer on our next visit and cut our time in other hotels down.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: jawrz
Reviews.Content: Everything you expect and could ask for bang in the middle of Singapore. Rooms are nice and kept well, staff is friendly Singapore style (regular travellers to Sing will now what this means). Breakfast is one of the best I've had in any Marriott hotel. Plenty of choice to dine out on your doorstep which is such a bonus in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Variable service in the most expensive Marriott I have ever stayed in - and at present it's noisy”
Reviews.Author: EssexRichard
Reviews.Content: Good location and fine new lobby but the drilling from 9 to 5 whilst refurbishment is undertaken is incessant and can be heard all over the hotel even in the restaurant on the ground floor Service at breakfast was variable and dinner too expensive to contemplate Prices were hiked up during the current air show making the hotel ludicrously overpriced so I moved to a better hotel at half the price

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel---Renovated Rooms are an Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Seattle0007
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent business traveler and I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past year. This is the first visit I have been assigned one of the newly renovated rooms. Overall the new rooms are well decorated and comfortable. I found the mattress to be a bit hard---I'm guessing it may have been new. The bathroom has been completely redesigned and is functional with two exceptions---first, there is no power outlet capable of handling a hair dryer in the bathroom. Second, a large mirrior has been added in front of the toilet which might not be appealing to some. Power outlets in the new rooms are multi-use so a converter is not required. The desk is a bit jammed into the area next to the window and the chairs are very low to the ground but they can be adjusted upward. The itnernet connection was above average. The fitness center at this locaiton is excellent and better than the Hyatt next door. The pool is also better and allows for lap swimming. The club is excellent and the food is well above average. The lobby renovation has been completed and represents and improvement from the old lobby layout. Overall I like this location for business purposes. The hotel is very accomodating and the staff excels at customer service. I will return to this location in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Jackhammers!!!”
Reviews.Author: machinis
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to get any sleep during the day, stay away! Renovations are in progress, and it is insane how loud it is!! Jackhammers 12 floors above felt like they were doing construction right above my room. Worst part is that when I approached the front desk, they stated "it's posted on our website"

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoboTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in February 2012. First, we arrived early in the AM after a 14 night cruise. We were given a corner room upon arrival and entered the room to find a fabulous view of this wonderful city. As I have a platimun card, we were given access to the executive floor which was fully stocked with very nice food for breakfast and for dinner with drinks included. Jared helped us get our boarding passes in the lounge which helped us out as we couldn't get them printed. I read earlier reports of others that were very critical of this hotel, but I think everything from the lobby, the 27th floor lounge to our room were perfect. One can catch the Hop on, Hop off bus only steps away, which takes you all over the city. A super place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “cosy, clean, new, a step out and you're in the shopping area”
Reviews.Author: soybeanyanyan
Reviews.Content: currently undergoing renovations so theres a distinct smell of glue or varnish in the lobby and elevators, but they put u in the new rooms with a gift of a plush toy dragon on the bed so u cant complain, especially as everything is new and so, clean. service is great as always.

Reviews.Title: “Central but Busy”
Reviews.Author: catman38ph
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriot early last year for a quick break. It is quite central to everything from shopping to restaurants and is smack on Orchard. Arrived at noon and had to wait for a room until 4 PM. Quite upset and threatened management that i would shower at the lobby fountains. Eventually got a room near the pool and near the construction. Staff were understanding and tried their best to appease me and even gave me a Marriot Card. I guess when you chose such a centrally located and really busy hotel you have to take the consequence of not having your room ready when you arrive. Restaurants were excellent and the rest of the stay went without a hitch. It is still less chaotic than Marina Bay which felt like i was in a mall and not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: sactokw
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 days here in January 2012 for Chinese New Year. Stayed on 9th floor. Main complaints: Some construction noise during the day, but front desk did warn us and weak flush on toilet (need to continue to push button to flush). Otherwise, all is well: room was clean; bed was comfortable; flat TV with HBO, walk in shower with good water pressure; excellent toiletry. Executive lounge on 27th floor was very nice with good food (breakfast, late afternoon/early evening appetizers) and service. Buffet breakfast in lobby restaurant was excellent with incredible spread (including Chinese, Indian, Japanese, European, American style breakfast). Gym on 4th floor had good work out equipments (treadmills, free weights, machines, water bottles, towels), but bring your earbuds to watch cable TV while on treadmill. Swimming pool was well designed and fairly large on 5th floor; comfortable in the Singapore heat. Location is on Orchard Street; lots of shopping centers; MRT and bus stop right outside the entrance, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Service, Food, Location”
Reviews.Author: GreatSleep
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 marvelous days at the Marriott Hotel Singapore. As we arrived in the middle of Chinese New Year, we paid for an upgrade to the 30th (top) floor where all the executive rooms were recently remodeled. The Executive lounge was unbelievable with complimentary breakfast, early evening appetizers, and free drinks every night! The location of the hotel was perfect and all staff members went beyond expectations to please us. We are in love with Singapore, the people, and can't wait to return to the Marriott on Orchid.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Samuel L
Reviews.Content: We have been visting this hotel over the past 15 years: we were loyal customers. This time we find the rooms nicely renovated: up-to-date and modernized, with walkin shower rooms in lieu of bath tubs, large flat-screen TV. Generally the guest rooms are much improved. But there is a lingering, terrible smell from the plumbing or drains in the bathroom that the staff could not get rid of despite of several attempts. It made our one-week stay most unpleasant. Admittedly the staff did offer a change of room: but we had a lot of luggage which would make moving quite a chore. And everyday we hoped they would solve the problem. Unfortunately the terrible stinking smell persisted. As well we found the food quality has certainly deteriorated. On our next trip, we may hesitate to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MakiWong
Reviews.Content: We chose the Singapore Marriott primarily because we had reward points that would get us 2 free nights. This hotel has a prime location at the corner of Orchard & Scotts roads, in the heart of Singapore's main shopping district. It's easy to walk to many places of interest and there's an MRT station right at the door step. The hotel itself is a pagoda tower. Each floor is octagonal in shape and houses 16 wedge shaped rooms. We liked that our room had angles.  The hotel is in the midst of a major renovation. The new lobby is already completed and is a pleasant airy space, has clean lines, stylish furniture, albeit a little corporate looking. Our room on the 6th floor had not yet been renovated. Generally in good shape although there were some stains and blotches in the carpet, the water system made groaning noises occasionally, and the lighting and electronic systems clearly needed modernizing, they worked but seemed antiquated by today 's standards. Generous bank of windows gave good light, king bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows, bathroom had plenty of towels and toiletries. Evening turn down service which we appreciated. As Marriott Reward members, we got free Wifi service. Local calls were 46 cents per minute. We needed one piece of clothing dry cleaned. We called and hung the provided laundry bag on the hook on the room door and it was picked up while we were out.  I called when we returned and it was delivered promptly. There was complimentary coffee and tea  in the room. We were disappointed to find very ordinary instant coffee. When checking out, the bell captain took charge of our luggage and invited us to wait in the lobby while he arranged for a taxi to the airport. Shortly, he informed us the taxi had arrived and brought the luggage out to the waiting taxi and stowed it away in the trunk, all this with a cheerful and helpful demeanor. While we had a pleasant stay overall, we felt that for a 5-star hotel charging 5-star prices, the hotel needed more features and amenities to compete with other equivalent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MrMoreira
Reviews.Content: In January I stayed for 4 days. I took up a grid to an executive room, including breakfast and free internet and access in the lounge. Value offered modest and it was wonderful. Exceptional service, with wonderful breakfast, bedroom and lounge incredibly delicious. A wonderful hotel option. The executive rooms are newly renovated and spotless. Staff very efficient, polite and pleasant. It was an incredible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Can't stay elsewhere now...so spoiled”
Reviews.Author: traveller2501India
Reviews.Content: Thank you Marriott for all the benefits you give me for being a rewards member...i love hanging out at the executive lounge...the location of the hotel doesn't get better than this...breakfast buffet is great coupled with warm hospitality...and the little gifts you find in your room occasionally, make your day :)

Reviews.Title: “Classy place in the middle of renovations”
Reviews.Author: Hithel
Reviews.Content: While far from a luxury hotel, I have never been disappointed when staying in a Marriott. The Singapore Marriott (SM) also happens to be one of the best Marriotts I have stayed in. While it's such a cliché to have a lobby with a fountain/waterfall and marble all around I admit that it works for me. SM certainly has me covered in this aspect with a very elegant foyer and reception area. At the time of our stay the hotel were undergoing renovations. We experienced the best of it by catching a newly renovated room without ever being bothered by any construction noise. Our room at the 28th floor looked great and definitely felt like it had been recently been given a facelift. Discreet beige and brown colors all around and a very modern TV-system is in place. The bathroom has a large Monsoon shower and (something that my lovely GF loved) a large mirrored make-up stand/corner. It's a credit to the hotel that the only thing I can complain about are the slow elevators and the gargling sound in the sink when water was running. We'd love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: ManFromIndiana
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Singapore hotel became my home for almost weeks during the month of December due to a business trip. Although there was construction taking place during my stay, the hours of the construction was manageable and I was able to obtain sufficient rest. The hotel staff were extremely friendly throughout my stay and they were attentive to my requests. As a Platinum member, I was able to gain complimentary access to the Executive loungh which offers ample opportunity for free tasty bites throughout the evening as well as a complimentary cocktail reception from approximately 5-7pm. Additionally, breakfast was available on the 2nd floor at the buffet which was honestly the best Marriott buffet I have ever experienced. The location of this property is fantastic and provides easy access to local shopping and/or dining options. A minimal taxi fare will take you elsewhere if you need to go someplace else to get away from the business of ION Orchard (especially when traveling during December's shopping spree). The rooms are clean and the bathrooms are very pleasant with both a tub and a separate shower. I found the room to be well maintained as well appropriately sized. Although I request rooms away from the lifts/elevators, I was given a room directly in front. However, the sound of the lift "ding" did not transfer through the door although there were a few occassions where guests became a little loud during late night/early morning hours. I would have heard theses guests though regardless of where my room was located. In general, I highly recommend this hotel as an option when staying in Singapore - especially during the Christmas Holiday period due to its location as well as decor. However, the cost of this hotel is a bit more than some of the other hotels in Singapore that are newer and perhaps located in less crowded areas. Be sure to look for special offers on their website as well as opportunities you are a Marriott Rewards member. I would love to stay at this property again in my future visits. Also - this hotel is GREAT for people watching and wanting to see high end cars parking in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away- Noise”
Reviews.Author: Doms1977
Reviews.Content: Stay away of the hotel until they finished the renovation!!!!!! and the room that has been not renovated are not at up to a five stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but........”
Reviews.Author: AsimDalal
Reviews.Content: You cannot ask for a better location. Ion orchard, takashimaya, paragon and Tangs are all at a walking distance. The hotel is very nice but the refurbishment noise is unbearable at the moment. We had two rooms next to each other and near the lift. The hotel staff had warned us about the noise so cannot blame them. The work starts sharp at 9 a.m. The gym has good equipments and the team at the concierge desk as well as the reception is very helpful. I will go back to the hotel once the refurbishment work is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping but dirty carpets”
Reviews.Author: kmjpm
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great if you want to be at the centre of the action on Orchard Road. However, there were two negatives for my stay. We were not a happy family when we arrived at 10pm (after a 9 hour flight with two young children) to be told that our rooms were not ready. It took another 30 minutes for the room to be available. The rooms were of adequate size and nicely furnished but the carpets were some of the dirtiest in the hotel rooms which I have stayed in. I have previously stayed at the Holiday Inn Singapore Orchard City Centre. It is a little further from the action on Orchard Road but is much more cleaner and has a higher standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: nadiaKL
Reviews.Content: For a number of years now, I have always stayed in this hotel whenever I am in Singapore for a holiday. Their quality of service is superb as always, especially Ali who always took care of my car and Rudy and Shariff who assisted me with my 90 years old handicap mum when I was there just last week. An excellent hotel and friendly staff as well with great facilites for handicap visitors. Wonderful location, the MRT is just outside the doorstep, with Tangs next door and the famous Orchard Road just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Presidential Suite is a so-so”
Reviews.Author: theprincessw
Reviews.Content: Considering the Marriott's reputation, I was disappointed that the Presidential suite is not as stunning as I had expected (not to mention the price). There is a small kitchen, a small living room, a tiny private pool, one bed room and big bathroom, all of which are the standard of all Presidential suites in other hotels. However, to get to the suite, you will have to pass through the pool-side restaurant, the pool itself and an alley way of steps. At night, the alley is very dark, with no lighting, which is a bit dangerous considering the steps. There was also not many compliment given in booking the suite, i.e I requested for airport pick up, which I found out was not included in the Presidential suite, in other hotels it would be. The service is also so-so, not top notch in any way. I guess the only advantage is just being in Orchard Road.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, easy to get around!”
Reviews.Author: ajmartinezp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, it´s easy to get around using the MRT, nevertheless it´s very crowded. The hotel staff is nice and friendly, the hotel is pricey compared to other Marriott hotels in Asia but if you can afford it it´s worth to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Under renovations. No sleeping in at this hotel after 9am!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninayama
Reviews.Content: Hotel is under renovations and the drilling sounds start around 9 am. I read other post warning about the renovations and they weren't kidding about the noise! I should have listened to them. We are on the 12 th floor, and our friends are on the 10 th and it's impossible to sleep in after 9am, or relax in your room through out the day. We are here till 12/23, so I'm not sure if they will suspend renovations over Christmas day/new years. Might want to rethink staying here if you have small kids who may need that extra hour sleep in after long day of sight seeing. Also note there is no laundry machines! It cost us $30 for 5 kg of laundry, the hotel will pick up your laundry and send to a laundry mat out in town. It took 2 days for us to get it back. So if you have small children it's cheaper to head to Cotton On and buy clothes for them, verse paying for laundry. Note the rooms are really, really small -- smallest I've stayed in for Marriott. Concierge service is not very informed about directions/maps to places etc. They are polite, and kind. But I'm comparing them to Japan where most concierge services will go above and beyond to help you with your sightseeing plans. So if you want help on directions etc, it is best to walk down to the visitor center on orchard road as they are more helpful. Breakfast buffet is absolutely delicious. The array of fresh fruit is amazing. Lots of exotic fruits you will never see in USA. And the selection of freshly made juices is the best in the world! Great location if you want to be in the heart of orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: utahfamilytravellers
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was the best Marriott we stayed at that wasn't a JW. The location is probably the best location in all of Singapore. The dim sum bar was awesome. The pool was the best urban hotel pool we've ever had. We wrote more details about it on our blog: http://worldfamilytravellers.blogspot.com/2011/12/hotel-review-singapore-marriott-hotel.html

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dreese1
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and very comfortable room (though smaller than I would have expected) - located near a MRT station on Orchard Road shopping area (not in the city centre). Just stayed overnight before catching a flight the following afternoon (late night taxi was $30 SGD from the airport and afternoon taxi to the airport was $19 SGD). Extensive and tasty food offerings in the executive lounge (but no made-to-order breakfast items like I've had at other Marriott Executive lounges in Asia). Singapore Botanic Gardens are a 20-min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels anywhere”
Reviews.Author: stilwtrjen
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel because the staff is so personable and eager to make your stay memorable! The Executive club is really nice, it's in a very central location. Fitness center and pool are great! The pool restaurant is great as well. The pool is very relaxing considering it is in the middle of town!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler60614
Reviews.Content: The Marriott has a perfect location on Orchard Road right near the subway for easy access to the rest of the city. It is situated in a fabulous shopping area; two big malls and another large department store are within two blocks. The hotel itself is still undergoing renovation so the lobby was mostly closed off and the rooms were still having the kinks worked out (we had duct work done when we were away). The new room style was very chic and perfect for a short stay. The bathroom had a wonderful rain shower and nice amenities. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the room service attendant at 1am after we returned from the night safari. This hotel will be beautiful when the renovations are complete, but in the meantime, they are doing what they can and have a beautiful 30' Christmas tree in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “High Tea in Marriot Cafe, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Nora L
Reviews.Content: It was a disappointing visit to the High Tea in Marriot Cafe on Saturday afternoon. As the main cafe is undergoing renovation, the high tea is currently located at 2nd level. Foods were very disappointing, From laksa to desserts.........I had never been so disapppinting as I do frequent the cafe (main lobby). I would said that with the price that I am paying, it is not worth at all. Hot coffee was serve cold and foods was not hot at all. But, something that impressed me was the supervisor, a lady, we made some complaints and she was very sweet and kind. She took our comments and she said that she will discuss with her chefs and staff. iI do hope that the cafe will take our comments seriously as we do depend on tourists and I do not want to disappoint them that this is how our foods tasted after we claim that we are a food paradise.

Reviews.Title: “not that "Marriott" , it could be better”
Reviews.Author: Due-reviewer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed there for 3 nights when arrive I aked the front disck to get a good room for me and he insures that he will , when I arrive to the room I find out that the room it smells like rotten cheese and they was installed a blower to move the air from the room to out side , I asked to change the room but he say its fully booked , after that I wait for some time but I cant stay in the room any more so I call him again asking for changing the room , he accept and give me another room but there is was a noise in the roof I complain but they say they are sorry as they are repairing some thing , again I just get what I get and thats it . if I go back again to this hotel because it just because I trust marriott brand but I will make sure that I see the room firest and make sure that the breakfast and internet is included

Reviews.Title: “Construction NOISE Alert”
Reviews.Author: jetcaptain
Reviews.Content: NOV 2011 --- Hotel is undergoing major renovation and all floors reverberate with the sound of jack hammers during the day. The sound travels throughout the building. This is a major renovation that I've been told will continue well into 2012. If you value a restful environment, then consider this hotel uninhabitable. They will keep trying to put you into a "quieter" room until you either give up and shut up about the noise, or just check out and leave like I did after about 30 seconds in several of their "quiet" rooms. My advise is don't even consider hotels like this who think they can renovate and stay open for business too. Go somewhere else and don't pay for a hotel that isn't finished.

Reviews.Title: “Shopper?!?!”
Reviews.Author: youbake
Reviews.Content: This is your bed and breakfast if you like to SHOP. We had a room on upper floor, however, they are doing some remodel work, so not as high as normal due to construction. Great Marriott. Staff was smart, friendly, accomidating and well trained. Lounge was very good. We enjoyed the "American Food" night during our stay with all of our typical favorites. Great Location for SHOPPING, "Main & Main". We had nice service and enjoyed our visit here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhoneycu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott for 2 nights while passing through Singapore. This is one of the nicest Marriott's I've stayed at, and I've been to quite a few. The staff were extremely attentive, with an excellent customer service attitude. I had several questions for the concierges or front desk staff, and they were eager to help. The location is a great place surrounded by modern shopping choices. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Prior to Cruise”
Reviews.Author: bmw32256
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here prior to our cruise in October. After a grueling trip from Florida we arrived after midnight to a beautiful room just waiting for us to crash. While the hotel is undergoing some renovation it did not impact us. They have a nice pool and fitness area that I used. The concierge was fantastic to us and overall their service was beyond expectations. After checking out and driving away in a taxi to our cruise ship we discovered we screwed up and left our passports and cash in the hotel safe. I guess that is what a 12 hour time change and 26 hour travel day will do to you. After an immediate Uturn and return to the hotel I ran up to the concierge who after I introduced myself said "no problem we have everything here in an envelop for you". He saved our vacation and our attitude. It is also nice being a Marriott rewards member and getting free internet access. For us tourists, the location was perfect, right on Orchard with a metro stop and Hop-On/Hop-Off bus stop in front. With access to various hawkers markets and underground food courts it is just what the doctor ordered. Location, location location!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: NoelBella
Reviews.Content: stayed at the marriott for 2 nights in Novenber 2011. Marriott has once again proven itself to have kept the good/excellent standards despite the on going renovations. We enjoyed the lobby (though it was partitioned off), room , spa, fitness, pool grill, gym... and most of all its ambience of cool and relaxing atmosphere despite being smack in the heart of busy orchard rd. Will come again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahNorwich86
Reviews.Content: Superb room with great facilities, emaculately clean and I was on the 30th floor, so I had a good view. I used the hotel gym and executive lounge a few times which were brilliant. But the breakfast was probably the best part, everything you could ever want, make sure you go there hungry!

Reviews.Title: “shop Orchard drop right here!”
Reviews.Author: RideIndian
Reviews.Content: Located on Orchard Road this would be the place to drop your heavy bags before you set out again to shop thru Singapores Best Sopping destination. I stayed here after the Conrad in the Marina Area so it was a hard act to compare with and since possibly because it feels like a London Hotel room after that but it has a great lobby and breakfast restaurant. Most of all i like walking off onto the street and wandering around to refuel when tired !

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Fault”
Reviews.Author: ogajim
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a couple for three nights in October in a pool terrace room (5th floor) with access to the Executive Lounge where we took breakfast and other perks. Singapore is a marvellous city where 5 star high-end hotels are in abundance and compete vigourously with each other. Having stayed in a number of them over the years the Marriott is up there with the leaders. There was some renovation works ongoing during our stay but these were hardly noticeable. The hotel is on Orchard Road/Scotts Road immediately adjacent to the best malls and in the heart of the business area.All main bus stops are right outside (particularly the 'hop-on hop-off' open-top tourist buses) and sits right on top of Orchard MRT. Service is outstandingly good with a very welcoming and appreciative air. The quality and presentation of the food in their numerous outlets was as equally outstanding. An outstanding hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SmilerP
Reviews.Content: This was our first long distance trip and it was made all the better for staying at the Marriott. The staff were wonderful, I had asked for flowers and champagne on arrival and to was their with a cake for my wife and a bowl of strawberries. The hotel is well located, step outside down an escalator and you are in the Orchard MRT station. We used this fantastic service the whole week. We are in the Exec Lounge, at the Pool Grill and in The Marriott Cafe all good. No noise from the work, intact no noise in the room at all. Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “perfect for business trip in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: masoncho
Reviews.Content: Marriott Singapore is an excellent hotel for short or long business trip. Location is great since most of the restaurants and shopping is walking distance. The staff is excellent,and I would recommend to upgrade to executive level to use the executive lounge. Hotel is very flexible on late checkout for Gold status or executive level customers.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: GTMom
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this Marriott many times over the past 13 years. Many of the same staff are still here and they always welcome us. If you have access to the concierge lounge, it is one of the best we have ever experienced - lovely food, drink, views, staff. The location is also superb - right in the heart of Orchard Road across from the Ion Shopping Center and other shops and great restaurants - MRT is right there also. Right now it is undergoing a major renovation and look forward to returning many time in the future to see the improvements!

Reviews.Title: “Well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: tnc2u
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at this hotel, which is located in a very nice area. We weren't blown away by it, but it did have a nice outdoor pool. Check out Sentosa island--I plan to stay there upon returning to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: jlabrie
Reviews.Content: This is not your average Marriott, which I consider to be nice properties by themselves. No, the Marriott in Singapore is spectacular. The rooms are fantastic, with great views. The breakfast buffet is not to be missed - it's got everything, including freshly made ice cream! Also, the service is second to none - they practically fall over themselves taking care of you. If you are ever lcky enough to stay here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but pricey hotel”
Reviews.Author: chattercubes
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, right at the heartland of Singapore. There's numerous shopping centres nearby especially Ion Orchard Shopping mall and most importantly, Orchard MRT Station. Rooms were average, service was just satisfactory. Nothing outstanding. Its noteworthy that it was quite pricey compared to similar 5 star hotels along Orchard Road

Reviews.Title: “Beware of your valuables”
Reviews.Author: TexasWiseTravel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend in late Sept 2011 and had a terrible experience. The cleaning maid stole my cash, US$240 to be exact. He (Yes I can identify the maid because he was really chatty and saw me leaving my room and asked what time will I be returning on that day. I thought that was an unusual question from a maid but didn't think twice about it.) took the money which I left in an envelope in my computer bag which I had put my computer bag in the closet before I left my room for the day. There were other currencies in the envelope and some more US$ but he didn't take it all in order not to create immediate attention. I didn't realize that my money was missing until I checked out and I was at the airport waiting for my next flight. I called the hotel immediately and filed a complaint but I knew there's nothing much they can do. I realized that there is a safe in the room to store your valuables but Marriot being a reputable chain and a 5-star hotel for this location and Singapore being one of the safest place on earth, such petty theft could happen. I blame the management at this location for the lack of proper training given to its employees and screening of the employees prior to hiring them. Please beware that there are crooks being employed at this hotel. I don't think I will ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Havanah
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this hotel. Unfortunately we did experience some disruption due to the refurbishment but the overall service was very good. It's located right in the centre - the MRT station is right outside the door. Look forward to visiting when the hotel has completed its re-fit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Excellent accomodation”
Reviews.Author: M_Gammal
Reviews.Content: This is the third Marriott hotel to stay at after Hurghada & Shar El Sheikh in Egypt The very same hospitality and almost typical room design One of my favorite hotels Great location for shopping

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, building old and tired, but they are doing a full renovation!”
Reviews.Author: GiuseppeSusan Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was expecting the Marriott experience but the friendly staff and excellent service was let down by how worn out the hotel is. They have recently started a renovation project to overhaul everything and the new lobby should be complete by end of 2011. I would recommend avoiding this hotel until then unless a new room can be guaranteed. The swimming pool is nice and so is the spa and massage. They had interesting pool rooms which seem to be normal hotel rooms which face onto the pool rather than be in a normal hallway. I had not seen this before and thought it was a nice idea. Location is excellent on Orchard road, which is the heart of the business and shopping parts of Singapore. Excellent friendly service was provided by all. Two notable examples: 1) On check-in the receptionist asked when our departure flight was so that she could book a taxi. We were unsure of it at that point and told her we would confirm it in the morning. Later that day she left a message to say she had looked up the flight time and had booked a taxi for us! 2) We were travelling with a child so the room maid got her a rabbit soft-toy (as its the year of the rabbit). It had a Marriot tag but was very appreciated by my 4 year old! Would I stay here again? Yes, but only in a newer room.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Minkyu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Marriott for 3 night in September 2011. Did not get to enjoy any of hotel facilities, so not much to comment about breakfast, swimming pool or gym. Location: Probably best in Singapore Room: Very clean but little outdated Service: Not much to comment Price: Very expensive, there are better hotels at much cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “as vibrant as the city itself”
Reviews.Author: aather
Reviews.Content: i was in singapore for a family vacation in may. we booked this hotel specifically for its location. once in hotel the checkin procedure was very smooth. we were allotted 3 rooms, our request for a connecting room was also met. each room offered a different view.the rooms were spacious and very well maintained. swimming pool was nice. one of the biggest advantage of this hotel is its prime location with easy access to the shopping area, it is also one of the bus pickup points for a ride to sentosa, we even grabbed food from mcdonalds at 3am which was just 2mins walk from the hotel. the staff were very cooperative and helped us with our travel arrangements also they were kind enough to give us room key replacements thrice.one should try the pastries at the pastry shop, they were just awesome. staying in this hotel made our trip even more memorable. looking forward to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay-close to Medical Center”
Reviews.Author: MaryLeeStenson
Reviews.Content: I had to have some medical tests done and the Marriott on Orchard Rd was the best location. 5 min walk to Mt. Elizabeth Center and 2 min walk to Orchard Rd shopping. Pool and gym were nice, room was OK in size (a little cramped with Daughter's rollaway bed in the room) but the service and executive lounge were very nice. Fantastic Breakfast Buffet in the morning with fresh honeycomb and choose your own freshly squeezed fruit juice/smoothie station. Wow.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: biztravel120
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Marriott Hotel - very central location and excellent breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Will i ever come back and stay? Most definitely.”
Reviews.Author: Pyng
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed for 3 days 2 nights and I have never been happier checking-in into good ol' Marriott Hotel than this particular trip to Singapore after our rather unpleasant stay at another hotel the night before which was one of those new modern boutique hotels. Seeing that this boutique hotel had zero personality and service, we couldn't wait to check-out and move over to Marriott.There is just something about the Marriott Hotel chain that is synonymous with excellent service and a guarantee of a great night's stay. I must reiterate again how strategic the hotel's location is. You cannot get any better than being right at the heart of Singapore's infamous Orchard Rd. There is so much to see, do, eat and shop just along that road which makes the hotel oh so convenient. You can visit it all day long and still pop back to the hotel for a little rest before heading out again all with the doormen/staff greeting you warmly at the door with a smile. In terms of location another major bonus is how near the mrt station is to the hotel. Just a few steps away and you can catch a train to anywhere in S'pore (even to the airport). Taxi's are abundant too. Although the rates and prices can be pretty steep, it was worth every dollar spent. The rooms are great and comfortable with a lovely king sized bed. We had an amazing two night's of sleep after the rather uncomfortable stay the night before at the other hotel. I love how the rooms are still very "traditional" in that sense with lovely neutral colours and Marriot's signature red. Our stay was absolutely wonderful and we look forward to our return to in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best part about Singapore”
Reviews.Author: rabbitloverHk
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed for four nights in one room at the Singapore Marriott in July 2011. We didn't like Singapore all that much but thank god we stayed at the Singapore Marriott, a stay that turned our trip into a nice holiday. Many people have said that the rooms are dated and need a makeover. Its true the rooms are not the most modern but I thought the rooms were very elegant and comfortable. They may be on the small side as well but this just made it seem so much more cosy. It felt so good to come back and relax in the room after a long day out. The sofa in the room converts into an extra bed, which is good if you've got kids. One of the best parts of the hotel was the pool. Its beautiful modern and relaxing. Its also very quiet there even though one of the busiest streets in Singapore is right outside. Its a little oasis in Singapore. As mentioned by many others, the location is unbeatable. The subway for getting everywhere in Singapore is right under the hotel. All around the hotel are malls with great shopping and eating at a reasonable price. You don't have to get stuck paying high hotel prices for food. Cabs come right up to the hotel often and are relatively cheap. Staff were great too, providing advice on everything and bringing everything you needed to the room. I don't think you'll go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service and Food at Pool Grill”
Reviews.Author: IRAcubeT
Reviews.Content: We (12 persons) celebrated my wife's birthday a week ago at Marriott Hotel, Pool Grill, against our better judgement. Thought we would try somewhere new for once. Arrived promptly on time and was one of the first to occupy the tables near the swimming pool at an upper deck. Despite ordering early we had to wait for over an hour for any sign of activities. My sis-in-law kept asking when the food would arrive, but all the time, the waitresses and manager kept excusing themselves. Finally, with 4 restless children complaining of hunger and 2 elderly folks waiting, we were served with food that looked hurried and even then, only one half of the table was served. The 4 kids had to wait a further 1/2 hour more for their ordinary fish and chips and this, having made noise again to the manager, who refused to apologise. Finally the kids' food came and was inconsistent. Some had more fries, some had not dressings, etc,. We got fed-up and talked to the Duty Manager. We had wanted to book Marriott for our buffet dinner at a later date, but has since decided against it. Would be an embarrassment to our guests if the same thing happened again. We definitely would not recommend the Pool grill to our friends and families. I just hope this coming week at Sheraton Hotel would be a blessing.

Reviews.Title: “When in Singapore...”
Reviews.Author: AlumofCU
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip back to Singapore and this time I stayed at the Marriott Singapore. Right in the heart of Singapore's shopping district. This hotel was very elegant. The rooms where great, I actually needed two and they connected which is nice for family vacations. Gym is excellent. Pool area is huge and excellent but noisy from street noise. The Concierge level is awesome and they have a strict dress code and no kids under 12, even with parents. Singapore is an expensive place to drink and dine and for those that are Gold or Platinum, this provides free really good meals. Not finger food like US Marriotts. Free booze if you are inclined. Great coffee machines. A+ for concierge level. You are right in the shopping district to every store you can think of is all within walking distance. Check with concierge for more info. Airport or Ferry cab service for 4 will run you about $50 or so with tip if I remember correctly. Singapore is a super wealthy and safe city so don't be shy about heading out at night at anytime really.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Cost in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: gebell
Reviews.Content: The Singapore Marriott is a great place to stay whether staying overnight or a few days in this diverse city. The hotel is top notch and the staff equally impressive. No need for a car during your stay as the metro is located adjacent to the hotel and can take you to most places in Singapore. I visited Chinatown, Little India, and the enjoyed walking around town during my two-day stay. There are plenty of restraunts and interesting places to see just a few metro stops away from this hotel and the staff will gladly arrange for a taxi to other places of interest that are off the metro line. For night life there is a club on site that seemed to be very active every night of the week. I've stayed at several hotels of this caliber in the region and the Singapore Marriott is one of my favorites.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ST61938
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel numerous times for business the last couple of years. I really enjoy the location around all the shopping - every time i return there are new shops and stores. There is now a huge high end shopping mall directly across the street. There are gads of great restaurants close by, both true local places as well as some chain type spots. There is a very good thai restaurant across the street that overlooks the hotel. Overall this is a very nice hotel. It is super clean, with very friendly staff and a wonderful buffet for breakfast. I think my rate included the breakfast so you should ask if its included there are fresh made juices and loads of asian inspired items for breakfast. This is also a fun people watching hotel, particularly early evening times there is a nice mix of people milling in front of hotel and fun to get a drink at outside bar and just watch. Overall, I enjoy this hotel each time here and try to stay there if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Top class hotel, good food”
Reviews.Author: kipper07
Reviews.Content: My room was well designed, on a corner with a big wide window with view down over Orchard Road/Scotts Road - with a nice bathroom and good shower. The service was very helpful, especially when I checked in early from an early flight arrival. The buffet breakfast is wonderful, a bit pricey at Sing $44 (about £25), but great display of fruits, pastries, exotic foods, omelette counter, etc. I was at a one-day seminar here, and the catering for the seminar, and the buffet lunch in the ground floor dining room were first class. The lunch had a great seafood counter with oysters on the shell, fresh swimming prawns, and a roast beef with yorkshire counter, as well as lots of others and great desserts. The pool looks good, but it was too hot to go in.

Reviews.Title: “good for business and location”
Reviews.Author: ste70ste
Reviews.Content: this is a typical Marriott hotel. very good for business not really for families (rooms are small and need refurbishment). Location is great

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marcudgal
Reviews.Content: I believe this is the only Marriott in Singapore. It is located right on Orchard, which is a shopping street. The location is extremely convenient and steps from the MRT. My husband has lounge access. And we very much enjoyed the food there. It was excellent. The rooms are clean and good size. Staff was courteous and provided us with information when we had questions. Overall, it was nice stay and up to the standard of another 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great shopping location”
Reviews.Author: vegas005
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with best executive lounge I have ever used! Hotel is right on Orchard Road with the best shopping you will ever find (although I found the prices very high). Plenty of Starbucks and local joints for snacks, dinner etc... You can't go wrong here. The 5th floor pool is super nice and there is a great little resteraunt overlooking the pool which I recommend. A bit expensive and the rooms are dated but overall very nice. Watch out for the hookers at night, so many you have to beat them off you with a stick!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: gbodis
Reviews.Content: The rooms are OK, just as you would expect from a 5* Marriott venue, but I wouldn't pay the extra S$$$ just to get this location. The restaurants are again...just average. There are far better hotels in Singapore even with more convenient rates..

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: AbroadAussie
Reviews.Content: The Marriott provides a lovely clean fresh room, with tea and coffee provided (unlike Heidelberg in Germany). As a tea-drinker (as opposed to my husband), I LOVED the tea station at breakfast, where I could determine how many tea bags in the pot. I had my tea! Husband happy with the coffee, though he said its quite mild and needs an extra shot of expresso to bring it up to scratch. The staff are very friendly...breakfast was delightful, though order fresh egg at the egg station, as there is prepared for omelette. 'Over Easy' if fried, or they are raw.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, food and service”
Reviews.Author: Bluesmanjt
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Orchard Road shopping and entertainment across from the Ion, Wisma and Takashemaya shops and food places. The MRT station is beneath the hotel and taxis are abundant. Staff is very courteous and helpful, and food is great. Breakfast and lunch buffets at the coffee house are some of the many highlights of our stay. Marriott Singapore is not cheap but worth the true 5-star value for location, comfort and service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: Fazzone
Reviews.Content: A very nice Marriott with perhaps the best Executive Lounge of any I have tried. There is also a tremendous dim sum restaurant in the hotel that is outstanding. Convenient to Orchard Road shopping and Newton Circus hawker stalls. Go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great room and great location”
Reviews.Author: mileagehopper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Oct 2010 for a 1 night stopover in Singapore whilst on-route to Mumbai. The room (suite) was just amazing, the bathroom alone was bigger than most average hotel rooms! Was a great location, able to walk nearby to major shopping centres, went on a city sights tour booked through the tours desk, well worth it for $35 SGD air conditioned bus all around the city and finishes off in the orchid gardens. The buffett breakfast in the exec lounge was good, large selection of different food and good view! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, top class property”
Reviews.Author: Vikrant11
Reviews.Content: Marriott is another of my favourite hotels. On my business visits to Singapore I stay in Marriott, centrally located, opposite the Orchard MRT, its surrounded by shopping malls, movie theatres and restaurants. It provides easy access to the shopping malls & other attractions in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, overal nice though can be upgraded a bit”
Reviews.Author: ChrisW70
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 times this year, Feb/Mar/Apr. Since I'm a Marriott member, I try to find Marriott hotels on business travels. As most people have said, the location is awesome, right no Orchard road; i dont need to say anything about that. As you check-in, the funny thing is there is a huge post blocking about 1/2 of the reception desk. I've stayted at many hotels and never seen this before. So if you are on one side of the post, you may now know if the other side of post that there is nobody waiting in line....its weird. Workers are nice and polite and friendly, check-in counter gave me iced tea on my arrival (not all 3 times though). They also gave me a pink lugguage tag. breakfast is good, though the noodle station is do-it-youself so that not so good. They have fresh squeezed juices, thats great. Including internet and breakfast, prices in the mid $300USD. Room is large enough, nicely appointed, but does have a little bit of an "older" feeling. Due the the 8-sided shape, windows are huge and they have the pull-over drapes. On 1 stay, my pullover drape got stuck and wouldnt pull anymore. On my last stay, right before I left for work, the lights went out on the floor (but not all lights). Taxi in the morning, in front of the hotel, can be a long wait. I am used to Taiwan where you can wave down a taxi anywhere anytime and usually are tons of taxi outside of 3-5 star hotels, there is very few taxi outside of Marriott. I think I've waited for 10 minutes for a taxi, which is a long time to wait. But thats general taxi problem in Singapore where I've waited long time for taxi at East Coast Seafood Center and other places. All in all, this is good hotel to stay, though if I wasnt a Marriott member and wasnt traveling for business, perhaps I'd find other hotels. For what its worth, I am recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, good people but need a little design magic”
Reviews.Author: suri85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a two night trip to Singapore for a family vacation and Singapore Garden Festival 2010. The first night I stayed at another hotel near Suntec Convention Centre and then moved to the Marriott for the second night. That was the first time I stayed at a Marriott so I had no previous Marriott experience to compare it to. I have to say that the location is probably the best aspect of the hotel, right on the famous Orchard rd and its shopping centres. There are an underground tunnel connecting the hotel to several shopping centres and the MRT station, in fact, I used the MRT and the underground tunnel to move from the hotel I stayed the previous night. The lobby was nice although it was a bit dark for my taste, but the check in process was quick. The receptionist was polite and gave me a glass of iced tea (which was very appreciated considering it was very hot outside) to occupy me during the check in process. I requested non smoking rooms but the receptionist told me they ran out of it but told me that they would provided an air purifier if needed. The room was quite big but I immediately found out that there was a construction project right next building, fortunately it was the weekend so the noise was not terrible. The design of the room and the hotel was a bit old and may run the risk of being outdated so I believe a makeover is beneficial to the hotel. The breakfast buffet wasn't bad but not exactly amazing, nevertheless the staff was nice. I had the same experience with the concierge, he was polite and knowledgeable; I asked about how to get to the botanic garden and he explained it clearly, he even offered to call a taxi for me. So to sum up: Best location if you want to stay near Orchard rd; nice, polite staff; need a little design magic.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off - this is a very good hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: GateE10
Reviews.Content: Don’t be put off by the negative reviews. While it may be just an average hotel by Singapore's over-the-top-crazy-luxury standards, it very comfortable and would be an upscale Marriott by most American standards. For me, this hotel is equal to or better than the Marriott's in New York or London. Further, it is an excellent value. Like New York or London, you can spend as much or as little money as you want on a room in Singapore, and the quality will vary accordingly. But the Marriott Singapore provides a comfortable hotel with excellent amenities and extras for a reasonable (true, not cheap) price. There are areas that are beautiful (the lobby, the pool, the bar, and the views) and of course parts that could use some upgrading (some of the carpeting). Where this hotel really excels, especially at this price point, is the location. You are steps away from the high end shopping on Orchard Road (Ion Orchard, Shaw House, Tang's, Wheelock Place). The nightclub district is just as close. The Singapore Metro has a station right outside the front door. There are several good restaurants right on the premises as well as within walking distance (and the executive lounge has great food if you have access). You are a short cab ride from the Marina district and the Singapore Flyer. And you are close enough to the central business district to consider this as either a business or leisure hotel. Do ask for a high room; Singapore is a bustling city with 24-hour noise, and the hotel bars are active well after 2am almost all nights of the week. Overall, the Marriott Singapore is clean and attractive hotel in a perfect location. While there are hotels in Singapore that are more luxurious - try the Ritz or the Mandarin Oriental - this hotel provides everything you would expect from the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in the Heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: danieLsr46
Reviews.Content: Location is the Key factor for this Hotel. You can go almost anywhere without getting wet because there is tunnel that connect this hotel to the Orchard MRT Station and major shopping centers (Tang's, Isetan, Shaw House, Ion Orchard, Wheelock Place, etc.) We booked 2 deluxe rooms and never mentioned about early check-in, but when we came around 10:30am, they give us the rooms without any hassle. The breakfast at the Marriott Cafe is wonderful. The taste and the variety is all perfect. And you could have your breakfast by sitting-in outside with the view of people passing-by the sidewalk on the corner of Orchard and Scotts Road. Got free-wifi connection as the Marriott Rewards member but never use this facility. Room is nice and modern with the partial view of Ion Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, dingy rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: kjmoksha
Reviews.Content: When we first went to SIngapore, we stayed in some other hotel but then saw Marriott and it looked grand and was right on Orchard Street. We planned to stay here in the next trip. And we did!!! but completely regretted the decision. The hotel undoubtedly had a great location as it is bang opposite Ion Mall and the clubs and restaurants. However, the hotel service was really bad. Very slow service, the rooms were very small and bad decoration and old and stuffy. The breakfast was average. and all this wid an exorbitant rate made the stay here a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: tripjunky72
Reviews.Content: Bang on the heart of Orchard road, the location could not have been more central. Close to the best restaurants and shopping the Singapore Marriott is the place to stay if you can afford it. I think it is overpriced but the convenience outweighs the cost. Rooms have a very nice view of the city and because of the design of the hotel each room has 2 large window walls - floor to ceiling (almost). The health club is nice and compact. A must stay.

Reviews.Title: “never stay this hotel!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: santyaudrey
Reviews.Content: do not ever stay this hotel. its my first time in marriot singapore not first time in marriot though. other marriot is better. singapore marriot they just happily charges big amount to you for every single broken thing and they claim its you that broke it. and you have no right to defences yourself even if its not your fault. the buffet is always empty, the bathroom is not so clean and the shower is broke. the room is small. no table for your luggage.and very expensive

Reviews.Title: “Last time staying here....”
Reviews.Author: AK2Borneo
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is in a central location, they have yet to maintain good customer relations going on my experiance over the last 10 years traveling to Singapore. I'm currently staying at the hotel and this will be my last. From the beginning have always had problems with reservations here, request king size bed, get twins everytime, while its not a real big deal this happening everytime we came was getting frustrating.
