The last time we stayed here was about 5 years ago, requested same king, non-smoking, neither was available when we checked in, they gave us a twin room that had been "converted" to a non smoking room which meant they sprayed air freshener in it. So here we are today, decided to give hotel another try, same thing happend no king beds only twins "I'm beginning to believe they don't even have king beds here", hotel is non smoking so thats a plus now. Was starving after the flight, so went to get lunch in lobby, a salad...took 30 minutes to get it and it wasn't the best added chicken sate, and tasted like it had been deep fried instead. So this is my last trip here, I'll go back to Royal Plaza, its across the street better service better rooms and better management.

Reviews.Title: “Conference at the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: fhuda
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at the Marriott. First thing I can say about the hotel ...very old hotel. They really need to do something about the fittings in the men's room. The ballroom that we were in had some trouble with the air conditioning, again huge issue. Lunch one of the afternoons ...the restaurant didn't have enough space to accommodate the guests. There was a big line outside the restaurant and it just wasn't right. The next day, it was a little bit better but several tables had to be set up in the lobby (the restaurant - Marriott Cafe - was next the the lobby). Good things, service was decent - but its Marriott so thats a given!! The lobby was nice because it had a glass ceiling which allowed a lot of light in during the day and I thought that was great. Nice pool bar, but would have been better with some moisture fans. Food again, was pretty good. Lot of choices at the buffet at the Marriott Cafe. Final comments, it may not the best place to have your meetings. But its might be a good place to stay given the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “OK - in need of a makeover”
Reviews.Author: AusBusinessTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for business for a few days. It was a convenient location, although the accommodation was uninspiring. Room was small and dated. Carpet was on the verge of being worn. Breakfast was very good though. Had problems connecting to the internet in my room, but it may be that it was my laptop's fault. Note that you have to pay for internet access unless you sign up for a Marriott rewards card.

Reviews.Title: “Thi hotel is tops.”
Reviews.Author: BarbGray
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I have stayed in, and I have stayed in many flagship hotels around the world. The service here was as good as it gets, and perhaps a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...A little Old but still a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: janey_bei
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for 2 nights last March. I have been going back and forth to Singapore but this is the first time I stayed in this hotel. If you intend to shop in Singapore this is the hotel to be. The location is right at the heart of Orchard. Below the hotel is Tang's and on the other side is Ion Orchard, Takashimaya, Isetann, etc. The MTR station is right outside the hotel. We went to sentosa and there is a bus that picks up customers right at the back of the hotel. Very convenient especially if you have kids with you. The buffet was really good, lots of choices and kids are free =) I only noticed that the hotel lobby is somewhat lacking but the rooms are quite good. Clean and comfortable. We went out after we checked in to grab some lunch when we're back there is a welcome cookie and a stuff toy that my kid really liked. Hotels can be very expensive in Singapore, we chose Marriott because of its location. Overall it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jidabhas
Reviews.Content: The room spacious rooms, comfortable beds quiet and clean. With your Marriott Reward member, you will be free wi-fi , most important if you are business traveler. Buffet breakfast was great with good selection of food and fresh organic drinks. The most part I love about this hotel is location. Surrounded with many shopping malls with very tight schedule, I could sneak out for very last minute shopping during my business trip. Overall, good hotel, good service, great breakfast, spacious room in great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: celinetsk
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay where MRT was just min. away. We have 2 children with us, and the hotel main shutter to Sentosa was just right beside of Marriott hotel. We don't even have to use the MRT to reach Sentosa, after all we just hop into the bus and they will bring us there, of course you have to pay the fare of the bus. The reception was friendly. Thanks a lot for the useful information provided by them

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: intheleftlane
Reviews.Content: We traded in some hotel points to stay here on Orchard Street, and we were so glad we did. The location is perfect--right next to an MRT stop and just about every bus line in the city. The staff were excellent, providing thorough answers to questions and stellar service with breakfast (breakfast included, despite paying with points = awesome). Speaking of breakfast, it's mostly buffet style, but it's a huge buffet with more variety than I've ever seen: I was happy with my yogurt, granola, and fruit; my husband was happy with some toast and scrambled eggs. Our room was very nicely kept and very clean (I'm a total stickler for cleanliness in hotels). The fitness center was a really pleasant surprise--it's really well maintained with lots of machines, all in perfect working order and private television screens. After walking around Singapore, trying not to move too quickly for fear of melting in the heat, it was really nice to get to the gym and work out a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: hippodiver
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 3 (2 year old son) and stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. The below review is based primarily on how "child-friendly" the hotel was. CHECK-IN PROCESS: Poor - We checked in around midnight due to late flight. The check-in process is usually the first test of how efficient a hotel is. There was only 1 staff at the reception desk when we got there and was busy with another guest which took a very long time. Another staff member appeared after 20 minutes (followed by 2 more staff) to serve us. I can never figure out why any hotel would take such a long time to check in guests! ROOM: Average - Another test we have for hotels in hot climate such as Singapore is the room's temperature control. Most indoor places in Singapore blast their aircon system. We turned the control up to 29C and set the level to Low and the temperature remained unchanged (cold). We had it turned off for most of the time. - Bed was comfortable as per trademark of Marriott hotels/resorts. - Room's furniture and bathroom were standard. - Internet was not complimentary. POOL: Good - Nice dissent size pool with wading pool so my son loved it. - No drinking water was given at pool side SERVICE: Good - Helpful staff doing their best to serve guests but it did not feel efficient in some areas. For example, our access card stopped working twice during our stay and we were told not to put the card near mobile phone! (Sorry, not really my problem if the access card is badly designed) LOCATION: Very Good - Probably the hotel's best feature: its location being very convenient for access to Orchard Road and nearby. OVERALL: Average - Good standard hotel with very convenient location. - We stayed there using Marriott rewards points. We checked its lowest price for the period of our stay and it was much higher than other hotels of similar standard. We don't think we would have stayed there for that price. Not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Rooms, Great Scott! (Street, that is)”
Reviews.Author: PhlyingRPh
Reviews.Content: On the corner of Orchard and Scott in the heart of Singapore, this hotel is one of my favorite Marriott properties worldwide. It is round the corner from my client, and the Singapore Metro is but an escalator ride down from the front entrance, so location-wise I cannot personally think of a better place to stay in Singapore. So, I've stayed here about 5 times in the past year or so and i can only think of one unpleasant experience with a staff member, and that was resolved immediately upon complaining. I have found the staff to be extremely helpful and the blend of Chinese-Indian-Malay hospitality is always so nice to experience. One call to the concierge and they will fix anything for you - even last minute - and even when they are about to leave for the night. I can't say enough good things about them. The ladies that manage the lounge are also simply amazing. So helpful and charming, and always up for a nice chat if one so desires. A lot of people have a problem with the shape of the hotel (it is built like a pagoda, so round-hexagonal), and I must admit on occasion when I have forgotten which room I'm in, I've walked the long way around to get to it but it's all good. Being hexagonal, some of the rooms are a funny shape, but I've never had one of the small ones so I can't complain. There was one occasion late last year when I was put into a lower floor room right across form the new construction next door and the workers were starting work at 7AM and finishing up well after 11PM - in contravention with their agreement. I moved to a room on the concierge floor (where there is less noise from construction) and apparently Marriott management made sure the construction company stuck to their agreed upon schedule - another reason I like this hotel. I can't think of anything I dislike about this hotel - in fact other than now minimal noise from the construction next door, and that too only if you happen to be facing the building during the day time, everything else seems to work flawlessly. Housekeeping doesn't keep annoying you if you want to sleep in, the concierge lounge attendants will even keep some breakfast for you if you call them and tell them you will be a little late, etc, etc.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Livebait3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very modern and in the heart of Singapore. We did not have a rental car while we were in Singapore and had to rely on taxis. There is tons of high end shopping near the hotel. This hotel was a perfect fit for us. I'd stay there again in a heart beat. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were super clean.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Experience”
Reviews.Author: HappyToTravel06
Reviews.Content: It is really a Royal experience staying in this Hotel. Very good location in the Orchard Road, well connected with all the areas. Taxis will be waiting in the entrance so no need to wait. Lobby is really a big one and really a nice one. Staffs are really carring and effective. when I have personally requested them to maintain the temprature at around 18 - 20 C, they have taken extra mesures to make sure that it is taken care. Being from hot country that really mattered lot to me. The food is really fantastic. Morning buffet is treat to your senses. It is very close to big malls and you will get everything close to you. They have curreny conversion centre near the front gate which is really nice to have if you miss to convert the currency in Airport. Overall Royal value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: williamtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott Singapore for 6 nights in April 2011. The nightly rate was higher than similar hotels in the area but I chose the Marriott due to location on Orchard Rd, coworker recommendation and Marriott rewards program. The guest rooms were clean and modern. The breakfast buffet was very good and a little cheaper if you include it in your room rate. ($44 after tax if not included in with room rate) The dinner buffet was good but not worth the money. ( $85 for the buffet and 1 bottle of beer!). The food republic at the mall across the street is good and much cheaper. The executive floor lounge is very nice. Water, soft drinks and wifi are available all day. The happy hour with appetizers (5:30-7:30) is great and can make the exec floor lounge worth your money. They have a bunch of food that could very well suffice as a dinner and the value of the free drinks adds up quick since a beer at the lobby bar is $12-$18. The sidewalk bar / restaurant is good for a beer and people watching - it is bustling until late. This hotel is definitely in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the cost - and bad Exec Lounge experience”
Reviews.Author: clarahelt
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in March 2011 in an Executive King room with Exec Lounge access 'benefits' at a cost of GBP 270/night. booked some months ago (to increase my chances of a good rate) via the Marriott website. I've been to Singapore many times but this was my Marriott stay. I've previously stayed at The Fullerton, Traders, Royal Plaza on Scotts, amongst others. On the positive side ... 1) Top-notch perfect location - and you sure pay for it! 2) Breakfast was also fantastic: I had it in the main restaurant (as opposed to the Exec Lounge): vast, great quality, masses of choice, excellent service. 3) Room facilities, cleanliness, soundproofing - no quibbles. The negatives .... 1) Disappointingly small room vs others I've experienced in the city and for the cost. 2) Exec Lounge: it's a big hotel and the place was usually over-run with people, making it feel very noisy and busy. Royal Plaza is also a big hotel .. but it managed to create a much more relaxing feel in it's lounge. 3) The "cocktail hour" was a joke: only two very basic cocktails - and neither of them Singapore Slings! Very meagre ... and the staff clearly knew nothing about making anythng other than basic drinks. (I wasn't expecting a qualified cocktail maker, of course!, but the Royal Plaza lounge staff will gladly whipped up amazing Slings and at least a few other options) . 4) The complimentary snacks varied greatly in quality: first night fairly nice, second night not. 5) The staff were ... variable. Some seemed quite genuinely pleasant, some just playing at it - and not very well; no follow through or sense of genuine care. This compared unfavourably with staff at the Fullerton, Royal Plaza, Meridien and any of the Shangri La hotels I've stayed at. 6) There's only ONE free laptop (ie not a proper PC) for the use of all Exec guests, with a usage limit of 20 mins - or 30 mins, depending on which staff member you speak to. Toally under-resourced; I'd have thought there would be at least three for a hotel that size. You can borrow an iPad but still .... And there isn't a printer attached either: one has to email whatever you need to print to a staff member; unfortunately I couldn't see an option on the Air Asia website for emailing my boarding pass so gave up and just made sure I got to the airport super early to check-in in the usual way. 7) They don't enforce the laptop usage limit rule: one guest, who'd promised me he would log off 'shortly' then refused to. He became verbally abusive as I tried to appeal to his sense of fairness. The staff member present at the time was a rabbit in headlights and completely failed to help sort the situation out ... very horrible experience. Overall I regret spending that much money at the Marriott and I wouldn't stay there again ... BUT I would go there for breakfast! Interestingly, it's the only hotel (from four I stayed at in Asia on this holiday) which I didn't receive a Feedback Survey request from after my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Courtous and Impeccable Staff”
Reviews.Author: pftambur
Reviews.Content: While I am a Platinum Elite Member of Marriott's program, this was my first trip to Singapore and this property. I was very pleased with the hotel and its staff. As an Elite member, I was provided access to the Executive Lounge. The full Breakfast in the morning and excellent evenings snacks and cocktails were some of the very best that I have experienced at a Marriott Property. The staff was very helpful and refused any gratuity, saying it was part of their mission to assist their guests. As for my room, while small in size, it was extremely comfortable with new furnishings. The bed was one of the new "Comfort Beds" that provided for excellent night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Purse Theft in Marriott Singapore - Cafe”
Reviews.Author: VNepicurean
Reviews.Content: Overall, my trip at Marriott was productive and business as usual. I AM TORN!!! I was treated very well my Fiona and JoJo at Marriott Cafe for the excellent customer service. I would have rated this hotel a 5 stars except for my purse was stolen in Marriott Cafe - so I have to downgrade the score.. to a 2. My trip ended with half a day at the hotel with the Community Police officer and 2 hrs the next day to get the report from the Police HQ. My purse was stolen in front of our noses. No one was in the Marriott Cafe and we were discussing business results over a late buffet dinner. We enter the Marriott Cafe at 9:20 pm meetings and ran to the buffet island to meet the 10 pm deadline. There were two servers who came back and forth to our table but no other customers were sitting around. The Cafe was quiet and had no one else approaching our table other than the two lady servers (change in napkins, removal of dishes, and hand wash dish). At 10:30 pm, I discovered that my purse which I hung on the corner of the chair was no longer there. When I was at the hotel, the hotel GM did not attempt to make correct the situation but did send their Office Manager to apologize for the situation. I requested them to call the Community Police and the manager said that they only come to the hotel if I lost my passport. I was aghast by the news but was too tired to ask for additional support since it was 1:30 am. I spent most of my time calling credit card service centers to cancel my cards. The next morning, I requested for the GM and the Office Manager. They were "busy" but the front office did call the police since I asked for additional information. I spent from 10 am to 3:30 pm with the police to have a statement and for the police to review the security tape. The police officers are following leads and are investigating but I had money, business notes, BBerry, and a Coach purse that was stolen. Due to the response at the time of my alarming the Night Shift manager, I was not fully satisfied with Marriott's immediate response and withholding information - so I am putting a 2 for the hotel stay. Breakfast Buffet - expensive (not included as in US) or should have been included as part of corporate discount WanHan Restaurant - fine dining if you are short on time. Very good service Spa and Pool - Outdoor pool which I did not use due to rain, did use the fitness room which was tight but had all the needed equipment. Room - overall - clean, no complaints. Marriott brand is consistent based on its brand name. Service - I experienced the extreme here - From excellent (JoJo and Fiona to Sharon) to the unclear communication and immediate investigation after I notified the night shift manager about my purse theft. I did not have transparency of evidences that were discovered until I requested for the police department's investigation. This left a sour taste in my mouth and very disappointed in Marriott for not havign a clear guidance for their employees for this situation. The Office manager did go out of her way to provide transportation to the airport and police HQ for me. I appreciated that. I will be notifying corporate Marriott and their senior leaders to alert them of such occurences. We had a list of hotels to choose from, and I have been loyal as well as dependent on the Marriott brand to deliver consistent services and experiences during my business trip to Asia. I chose Marriott due to the brand and was disappointed that my purse was stolen while I was in its safe and secured premise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, expensive!”
Reviews.Author: freobhoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for 5 nights at the end February 2011 on my monthy business trip to Singapore. The rooms are nice, probably a little larger than average Singapore, and well laid out. Nothing fancy, but nice enough. Gym and spa are OK, gym had a range of cardio machines (no rowing machine though!), not huge but sufficient. Breakfast buffet was great, good selection of food and drinks. Food in the cafe restuarant was nice. Service was of a high standard in all aspects of the hotel. It is right in the middle of Orchard Road, and if it is bucketing with rain you can still get out and into the shops / restaurants without going outdoors, particularly to the massive Ion Orchard Shopping Centre. Overall, good hotel, good service, great breakfast, average rooms, average gym, great location. The only negatives were that you do not get free internet, and you certainly pay a hefty price to stay here, I have had equally good hotel experiences in Singapore for much cheaper room rates, just the location that sets it apart.

Reviews.Title: “Rest and relaxation amid the rush of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: jenny4319
Reviews.Content: The Marriott Orchard Road offered us all we could wish for A bit pricey but, worth every penny or cent! Spacious rooms, comfortable beds really good selection of food to siut all tastes and diets.

Reviews.Title: “Royal stay”
Reviews.Author: MumOra
Reviews.Content: The Singapore Mariott is a royal place. Spread over a large area, the rooms and are huge and roomy. The customer service and facilities are good. Note worthy are the innovations done right from the designing of rooms to things like room key operated elevators. A must read is the mariott book with contributions from the employees across the globe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean, but nothing else really.”
Reviews.Author: esaun21
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a superb location, with wonderful access to everything in Singapore, including the subway, but overall nothing special and just your typical Marriott hotel, besides the fact everything was quite expensive. Enjoyed our stay but probably would choose another property if we came back to Singapore. We did enjoy the pool area, room service, and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: laurascudder
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I probably wouldn't have picked this hotel if I hadn't been attending an event there, since I'm not much of a shopper and its main attraction is being right in the middle of the city's main shopping district. That said, I had a comfortable stay: our rooms were small, but looked recently refurbished, quiet and clean, and the lobby was a very calming contrast to the bustle outside. You could hardly be closer to the subway station, which is good, because while the food courts in the malls around the hotel have franchise versions of some of the popular Singapore hawker food, for the real experience you will have to get out of Orchard Rd. The biggest annoyance is that for all you spend on the room, you still have to shell out for any sort of in room wifi - a modern necessity.

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the bad reviews - had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderer2342
Reviews.Content: After reading quite a few lukewarm reviews on this site, I checked into the hotel with trepidation. But I found the negative reviews completely unjustified. Although I arrived at 9:30 AM, they already had a room for me, with great view of Orchard Road. Contrary to other reviews I've seen on this site, the room felt new and clean. It wasn't an enormous room, but it was big enough to move around in and the bed, furniture, etc. were all comfortable and spotless. It had a great location, close to the Newton MRT stop and at the end of Orchard Rd. I did use the gym and thought it was one of the best hotel gyms I've seen in awhile with brand-new equipment, fresh towels and water, etc. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: bagaglio
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times at The Marriott Singapore. It's a very good, if not an excellent hotel, which is located at the very heart of Singapore (though note that travel by Taxi to the hotel is not quite so straightforward as one would think - involving a detour along and around Scotts Road, which in peak hour can add 10 minutes to a 15 minute journey!) Of course, it is a true 5 star hotel, the staff are always very helpful and attentive and the amenities are well up to the standards expected of an international hotel. Why not 5*'s across the board? I've stayed in a number of rooms on a number of occasions and found them to be variable - overlooking the adjacent high rise building site some 20m away on one occasion, and then tucked in a corner near the swimming pool on another. I have also found the Marriott to be expensive. Sure, you can get good deals, but only some times. On top of your room cost, I found the breakfast at S$38 to be too expensive, especially for a business breakfast - $38 for some fruit, a bowl of cereal and a coffee??? The outside bar is also expensive - a couple of times I've been stung $80 for a 'pub meal' with a couple of beers - that's for one person. Heck, I'm grumbling way too much. There's no doubt that the Marriott is a very good hotel, but just be very careful what you pay for things and you'll have a great time. However, if you're price sensitive, then just as good quality can be found for a good deal less.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great service and great exec lounge”
Reviews.Author: Kate70
Reviews.Content: On Orchard road so in the main shopping area. Great service- staff very welcoming and remember you by name. Rooms modern and well furnished. basic coffee making facils- wld have welcomed nespresso machine but only thing I can find to fault this hotel. Exec lounge is brilliant- superb food and cocktail hour, fab breakfast up there and cakes during the day if you can get in...only slight problem is everyone else seems to know about this gem so very busy and you struggle to find a table and seats... If looking for a modern hotel- this is well worth staying in- for a more cultural experience and higher price- try raffles.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Always Stayed here for Business when in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: JSMBali
Reviews.Content: Whenever I travelled to Singapore I always stayed in this hotel. Most trips were for business. I started staying here in 1995 and was never disappointed. The hotel added the pool side villas a few years back and they are wonderful. Gym is good and food is excellent. Spa is top quality. Poolside terrace restaurant is excellent. Staff were always friendly and helpful and I was never let down. This is also in an extremely convenient location on Orchard Road so just pop out of the hotel and there are numerous places to shop (LV just around the corner) and great places to eat. Highly recommend this hotel if you're visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “It is just not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: mehnazansari
Reviews.Content: I redeemed by Marriott rewards points to stay in Marriott Singapore for a weekend. I was travelling with my infant and six year old child along with my spouse. As we enetred this hotel right on Orchard road, there was a very gloomy dark reception area. We had to stand in que for 20 mts to register ourselves. No personalised service . The room was traiangular in shape facing another under construction building so there was no view at all. Air conditioning did not have temperature control. Kettle was really old and shabby. Carpet was brown and dirty. I had requested for a baby cot and stroller which was provided but there was no room to keep stuff. wardrobe had no shelves. Bathrooms were old yet OK. Towel quality not good. Bed was just fine. Nothing extraordinary. I have stayed in several Marriotts but this one is definitely not for me. Age is really showing on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you want to enjoy shopping in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Sameer_Pune_India
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very good rooms. Great food with an awesome buffet spread. Close to the MRT station, so travel within the city is extremely convenient. Awesome location if you want to enjoy Singapore shopping. Some great malls around this place. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy”
Reviews.Author: estatictravellers
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to Singapore numerous times and decided to stay at the Marriott for the first time. We were very disappointed as we had paid for an Executive level room which was quite expensive and found the rooms were very old and in need of an urgent update with stained carpet. Not what we expected for a hotel of this star rating. The first room we were given I can only say was awful. Very old furniture, very dated, very dirty carpet and it had an awful stale smell to it. We had travelled 13 hours from Europe, were very tired and I rarely complain but I felt for the money we were paying this was very poor. We asked to be moved which they promptly did, to a level above and it certainly was a much better room, more updated with a nice view. It wasn't until night fall that we realised we were directly under the Executive level dining and bar area, so we were treated to hours of a constant noise of footsteps which was the clattering of high heels on tiles above us. This continued until mid night and then started up again at 5 am for preparation of breakfast. We lasted two nights and bleary eyed asked for another move. We were moved to another room at the other end of the corridor and finally had one good night's sleep. The Executive Lounge was very good, with great food, good pool area, great breakfasts, but on the downside no free internet which was available all through Europe in hotels of much lower standard. We had stayed at the Pan Pacific on the way over and it was amazing at half the price, with free internet. We were very disappointed at the standard of service and with so much competition in Singapore I cannot understand why anyone would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A good Hotel and in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JackyYC
Reviews.Content: Marriott Singapore is a comfortable Hotel located at the heart of Ochard Road. There is no question to the location and the marriott brand-- they are definitely above average.However, I felt the regular rooms+Bathroom are slightly outdated and showing in needs of a refurbishment (vs the rooms at Hilton Singapore)

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, usual Marriott quality”
Reviews.Author: anhei
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location at Orchard/Scotts intersection. Hotel has very good restaurant offerings and generally offers a very consistent Marriott experience. Check-in and Concierge very helpful and always available. Rooms show their age - a overhaul would be adequate. Pool area is not very spacy but OK for a business class hotel. Definitely on the pricy side, one can find better value for the money in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “What's gone wrong?”
Reviews.Author: sunny045
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Marriott twice this year and not sure what has happended between June and September, but one problem after another. I booked to return to the Marriott simply because the accomendation and service previously had been first class. Now I arrived to find that had no knowledge of my booking. After some time they find me a room, right opposite the building site with workman quite happy to look into your room! The grouting in the bathroom was very grubby and part of the marble was chipped. I asked for a new room and boy what a performance that was. You think I had asked for the presidential suite. In view of their charges, this really is not good enough and with so many good hotels to choose from, I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Ageing gracefully”
Reviews.Author: Daniel083
Reviews.Content: Great location - at the junction of Scotts Rd and Orchard Rd, right in the heart of the shopping district with several major shopping centres just minutes walk away. The hotel itself is getting old (constructed I think in the early 90s) but it is ageing gracefully (although the lobby is showing its age especially in terms of design). My room was spacious and was of an acceptable standard - the only real let down was that although everything in the bathroom worked well (good water pressure for the shower, etc), it had clearly never been refurbished over the years. Breakfast in the coffee shop (which was included in my room rate) was fine - good selection of both Western and Asian breakfast items. Check-in was smooth and staff were generally friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Never ceases to amaze!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTriper
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! Location is perfect. This was my second visit in 4 months, but never seemed out of place. They made every effort to ensure I had a pleasant stay..complimentary moon cakes included :-). The breakfast and evening snack (part of my Platinum package) is always quite filling. They did go the extra mile to ensure I wasnt charged extra due to the F1 race weekend rush. Incidently every other hotel in town had hiked thier rates for this wknd. I will definately visit again and recommend to everyone who wishes to enjoy comfort...in true Marriott style!

Reviews.Title: “They know how to charge”
Reviews.Author: PaulsReview
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for over a week. The rooms are small but clean. They would only let us sleep two people per room so we ended up booking two rooms. The rooms are very expensive even by Singapore standards and they charge you for everything that they can. Most hotels now offer free Wifi etc for their guests but not the Marriott. So we used the business centre and it was very expensive to use the very slow computer and printer. Breakfast was also very expensive. There was lots of choice at breakfast and lots of staff which given the cost was not a suprise. We ended up checking out and moving to another hotel in the area which was a third of the price, had bigger rooms and even gave you a free bowl of fruit a bottle of wine and some chocolates when you arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel with great services”
Reviews.Author: R_Maharani
Reviews.Content: Stay few nights at deluxe room with my family,the breakfast was super delicious and good quality, the room service food was delicious,a fresh scent 24 hours each time you enter the room,the room was tiny compare to Meritus mandarin Orchard but everything works (the tub,the bathroom etc unlike Meritus Mandarin where the AC always...always broken) My Mom hates this hotel its Insanely expensive

Reviews.Title: “A Marriott is a marriott”
Reviews.Author: chocolate-eater666
Reviews.Content: Arrived in the fab city of Singapore and walked into a fantastic entrace with a buzzing restaurant looking outside where everyone is people watching. And a great place to people watch being right at the start of Orchard Road. The MRT is straight underneath the hotel plus a maze of corridors which veer off to different underground shopping centres. Getting lost is easy. Loads of other eateries around make this a brilliant location to stay in singapore. There were a few aspects that disappointed us and one was we asked for a double non smoking room but on arrival we were offered either a twin bed non smoking or a double where smoking had taken place. We were told if taking the double it would be no problem as they would put a dehumidifier in there for us. So we took this and even through they put this dehumidifier in the room and it was on constantly, you could still smell the smoke very faintly. Also on leaving the room into the corridoor, the smell was worse which meant we were on the smoking floor. Hotel had a nice but cold pool, gym, spa etc. The spa was seperate male and female which when we wanted to go together this was not possible. Other things like a nice bakery downstairs, business centre etc However what was a huge letdown was the cost of internet which I needed for work. 1 day access cost something like $25. Internet should be free in this day and age and especially in a high tech city such as Singapore. It was even more off a rip off that you could choose the slow speed for $25 or paying for a premium speed costing even more which in itself was slower than the speeds we get in the UK. Overall the rooms were nice, a great bed, lovely bathroom and showe, and it had a nice view but in the end a marriott is a marriott and leaves little room for character.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: Mistycat
Reviews.Content: This was my 6th trip to Singapore, each time I stay at a different hotel. This time was the Marriott and will be hard pressed to want to stay else where after enjoying our stay. I stay in Singapore on route else where and stop off for a few days, as I love to shop I prefer a hotel in this area, the Marriott was close to the shops and MRT. Only ate breakfast in the hotel as we were taken out by our Singaporean friends for evening meals, the breakfast was good and we could chose to eat outside. The room was clean and TV had decent channels, it was a good size, our room over looked the pool, no complaints about noise. We went down to the pool twice and did find it hard to get a lounge, could do with the pool attendent checking on loungers more often. For the vibe, friendliness and location I will definately stay next time if I can get the same great deal.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Marriotts ever....”
Reviews.Author: RunawayRainbow
Reviews.Content: Okay, so they may not have the teppenyaki grill in the Exec Lounge that Bangkok has....but THIS is the best Marriott I've ever stayed in. The pool is beautiful; fantastic. Excellent and timely customer service. 24 hour business center for your needs......and of course, location, location, location. You are amidst the bustle that is Singapore. I've stayed in a hundred Marriotts but this one blew my mind. Keep on doing whatever you guys are doing; I was greatly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly convenient location for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: shantichop
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of orchard road and near many department stores.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever.. ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Trill86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty impressive from the moment you arrive. You instantly escape the muggy hot Singapore weather as soon as you enter the lobby of the hotel. The staff were so nice and helpful. There was never a request we had of them that they did not meet. They went out of their way to make themselves known to us which I thought was really impressive. What made the whole trip even better was the attention my mum (who is disabled and in a wheelchair) received. The whole hotel is disabled friendly which is fantastic considering so many hotels are not. The rooms were beautiful. My sister and I shared a pretty standard room which had everything we needed. My parents were upgraded to a suite which had a small lounge area, 2 plasma TV's and a huge bathroom with Bulgari toiletries to match. The breakfast buffet was outstanding. Whatever your heart desires, you will find it there. And they had made to order omlettes and waffels... so yum. So if you're looking for a beautiful and central hotel in Singapore, I recommend the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Meets your expectations!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugManila
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for four days and absolutely loved it! The extra cost to upgrade to club level is definitely worth it as the cocktails and snacks were a great and relaxing way to unwind after a day out in the heat. Breakfast at the coffee shop was a good variety but we loved the fresh fruit and vegetable bar the best! The staff, esp our co-Filipinos, were always courteous, helpful, and welcoming. From the location to the comfortable rooms and excellent service, Marriott never disappoints!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: onlythemostawesome
Reviews.Content: Smack on Orchard, right next to Tangs mall, above the metro station and right opposite Ion mall - you can't beat the location of this hotel! The lobby is a standard business hotel lobby - lots of people everywhere! The rooms appeared new, were big, with all amenities you expect in a good 5-star. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. We used their swimming pool which is on the rooftop, and it's probably the cleanest waters you''ll ever see! The pool itself is beautiful with low beds built in at almost water level. One of the nicest pools we've seen in a hotel. The concierge was very friendly and eager to help and kept coming up with great options of things to do. They also volunteered to make reservations everywhere we wanted to go. Overall, a great stay. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent LOCATION! Superb Adequately size room with loveseat”
Reviews.Author: dutseal
Reviews.Content: This is the best located hotel in all Singapore. You can just walk out of the hotel and immediately there is an escalator you can ride down one level that will connect you to the Wisma Atria, Takashimaya Mall, and Ochard MRT station, via the underground pass. You can go down one level (right in front of the hotel) and it will take you to the Ck TANG food court, with good food for CHEAP! I was travelling with my 9 year boy and when we checked in there was a little cut tiger toy waiting at the bed. I guess it's the Marriott symbol? Too bad we could only secure one night at this hotel due to the high season..however I managed to secure another night at this hotel several days later, and again we were given the same tiger toy...to my son's delight! Room was above normal size with a king size bed, a desk, and a loveseat. The restroom was small but it was clean and the most gorgeous feature was the high jest pressure shower! What a feeling. I love taking shower in this hotel. Staffs were friendly and courteous. The only downside was when I left my personally engraved picture of my son on a keychain. It was our mistake but we accidentally left it on the ironing board with my small leatherman. I even had a picture of them on the ironing board because at the same time I was taking a picture of the model of the excellent dry iron boaard made by Phillips. When I called back immediately they said they did not find it. How could it be? I guess someone took it. It was a heart shaped tungsten keychain, and on one side my son's picture was engraved, on the other side, our initials were engraved. Hmm...it was more like a personal loss than a monetary loss.

Reviews.Title: “Good location-dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: CapeT0wn
Reviews.Content: The position is excellent,near the MRT. Sadly the rooms and bathrooms are very dated, and need an urgent renovation. The bedrooms are small, and the carpet in our room was badly stained. I doubt whether I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice if you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: Bahnreise
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in the Singapore Marriott on business. It is well located in the shopping district, and is quite elegant, although a little threadbare is areas. The staff was very polite. My reservation was honored without fuss. My room was on the 11th floor with a view of Orchard Road. My room was nicely appointed with a reasonable size bath and a nice sitting area and desk. Free internet for me as I am a frequent Marriott guest. Bed was amazing ! I caught a whiff of mold aroma while walking down the hallway on my floor. Colleague of mine noticed mold smell to a greater degree in his room on the 13th floor. But, Singapore is very humid and it rains frequently. Concierge lounge was very nice. Decent Asian and western breakfast spread. Evening snacks ok too. It does get packed at meal time. Free wireless internet on the concierge lounge. The hotel had fresh orchids in the lobby, on every floor, in the restaurants, and changed them out during my stay. Lots of attention to small details. My biggest complaint is that for a business hotel, the business center is absolutely mercenary if you have the misfortune to need to print a documents from a computer file. Hold on to your wallet-$2 Singapore dollars a page. $.50 a page to copy an existing document. Even so, I would return, It IS a nice hotel. I just will not use the business center unless I want to dip into my retirement fund.

Reviews.Title: “MUST AVOID THE RESTAURANT”
Reviews.Author: galexis505
Reviews.Content: Went for a family lunch on Sunday. Having been to the hotel for their Sunday brunch before, I was looking forward to a delicious meal. Sadly what I got was very bad quality food, restrain choice and a bad stomach. We pretty much all suffered from diarrhoea straight after the meal. The lobster had clearly been defrosted as the meat looked intensely red and was VERY chewy. The sauces that accompanied the Crustacea were not refrigerated. The dim sum tasted so old and straight from the freezer. Duck pancakes felt as they had been made the day before...etc The more I think about it , the more I can see where I could have been infected with a staphylococcus. It is a disgrace for a hotel of this standard to serve this kind of reheated-old food. The bill was not cheap and I expected a much better food hygiene standard. First time this happened to me in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good to relax in that hectic city”
Reviews.Author: gmo0173
Reviews.Content: stayed there for a 1 day stopover. Therefore, the location was perfect: easy to find and very easy to reach from the airport because it is just on top of a subway station. Checkin was efficient and professional. Before I explored the city , I relaxed at the pool for a while, which was probably the most memorable part of the hotel for me: Very nice outdoor pool, elegant resting-area and bar facilities. Only the noise from the busy streets could be heard at the pool area. (but not in the room.) Well then again due to it's location, it is a good starting point to explore the city ... Overall, I would love stay there again for the next stopover

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but hospitality is not warm!!!”
Reviews.Author: armin1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel twice because I did not have any other options available. On both occassions this hotel failed to impress me. Rooms are like pegion holes, very small and uncomfortable. Though this hotel is situated on Orchard Road which is one of the best locations in Singapore, the rooms do not have good view. Staff is also not warm and hospitable. Not a very pleasant stay. On the whole my experience is below average.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: rivegauche372
Reviews.Content: Service and facilities-lets down Marriott brand. Lobby and room layouts and lighting feel uncomfortable. Room service took an hour to deliver! Had to call "At Your Service" twice to follow up! Really disappointing service. No good value for the money you pay. Only consolation is it's location. But will stay in other hotels in the area next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best on Orchard!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTriper
Reviews.Content: Its luxury personified. Right from the location to the in-room comfort. The breakfast spread is good, lounge facilities are excellent. The sleep quality was the most striking feature on this visit..The bed just lets your worn out muscles sink in..special is an understatement! Do want to visit again..just to experience the sleep atleast :-)

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Convenience at Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: JoeCool_KL
Reviews.Content: This hotel's major plus point is that it is smack right in the middle of Orchard Road and extremely convenient. It is next to Tangs Departmental store and across the Road from the new ION shopping center and Borders Bookshop. All of these buildings can be reached easily through the underpass without having to cross the road. Hotel facilities and rooms are what you can expect from a typical 5 star hotel like Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: alohagirl808
Reviews.Content: Location: Awesome location near MRT and right in the middle of orchard road, near many shopping malls and restaurants. Hotel/Room: Hotel is very nice with all the amenities you would expect of a hotel at this level. Very nice on-site restaurant. Though I never used these amenities, they do have a nightclub/bar, spa, gym, pool, Jacuzzi, and steam room. There is construction going on next door, but I wasn’t there much during the day and I didn’t hear a lot of noise. I had room 1916 with partial views of orchard road. The room was very nice, a good-size with nice furnishings. It had a king-size bed, desk, sitting chair, flat screen tv, very nice bathroom with dual sinks, separate bathtub and shower. Lots of storage areas, mini-bar with room to store your drinks. You get 2 free bottles of water a day delivered to your room. The only negative about the room was that the bed was a little too hard for my liking. Breakfast buffet: I had to mention that the breakfast buffet was awesome. Some rates include the breakfast, if not, it is very expensive. Lots of choices- Made to order omelets, eggs, sausages, bacon, hash browns, other hot foods, different types of pastries and breads, lots of different fruits, freshly squeezed fruit juices, and they also make smoothies. Overall a very nice hotel, with friendly staff and excellent service. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Beautiful in the night”
Reviews.Author: Aakash16
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the location of the hotel but overall it is a decent hotel to spend time, yes the orchid road where it is built is awesome

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with great service.”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels for the $ in the area. You get excellent service to go along with nicely done rooms and the ideal location for great access to everything you can think of whit in walking distance. There is a bit of construction going on across from the hotel so the noise could be bothersome if you are facing that way.

Reviews.Title: “Good one!”
Reviews.Author: AshishNPatil
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel has all one can ask for. Very good standards maintained. Happened to go there in evening, it just looked so beautiful, you could say it was really another viewing site. Excellent cuisine. Ofcourse they did not provide all types of food stuff, but, whatever they provided was superb. The day ended good there! The staff is really helpful. My little brother was asleep, so, they provided him a small bed till we were finished with eating!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, near MRT, shops and food”
Reviews.Author: thenay84
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel. I did ask for a room away from the construction, and despite what people have said about the noise from the club, I didn't hear it at all and I was on floor 7 and was overlooking the pool and Orchard Rd. In the lobby I could hear it though. Overall, rooms were clean, bed was great, slept well. It was close to places to eat and shop at. On top of the MRT, which gets you to and from the airport. Among other places. Many bus services on the road as well. The pool was good, and the hot tub/cold tub was a surprise. The steam room was much needed after a long day of walking. I can't wait to go back one day, this hotel will be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but run down”
Reviews.Author: I_too_enjoy_travel
Reviews.Content: Mariott has an amazing location - on the Orchard Road and has great connectivity. However, this once great hotel has lost its charm due to poor maintenance and upkeep. Most of the hotel seems like ready for renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Concierge lounge food & service but hotel needs updating”
Reviews.Author: DianeER
Reviews.Content: The Concierge lounge food & service is the best I have ever seen at any Marriott. We were platinum members for many years but are now just gold status. We have stayed at a lot of Marriott's over the years but this one was surely the best concierge lounge we have ever seen. The service here was exceptional & so was the food- free alcohol from 5:30-7:30pm, excellent breakfast also. Plenty of attendants pouring drinks, clearing tables, talking to guests, putting out food- it was a real pleasure. However, the noise from the construction next door is very loud & as is the noise from a bar located near the hotel Note to Marriott corporate- The US Marriott's could learn a lot from this concierge lounge as they are generally poor in food quality & service in comparison. However, the rooms are smaller than normal due to the strange shape building. Also the hotel is 15 years old and needs an updating. The rugs definitely need to be replaced. Pros: excellent service & food in concierge lounge excellent gym & pool area MRT (subway), right outside the hotel doors free internet via wi-fi in concierge lounge only small refrigerator in room very comfortable beds (especially compared with the rest of SE Asia), beds typical of Marriott quality in the US good quality towels & toiletries free bottled water, soda, etc. available 24/7 in concierge lounge great location on Orchard Rd near shopping Cons: rooms need updating, they were updated but not overhauled which they need to be room small but hotel was not built by the Marriott. rooms are strange shape no free wi-fi in rooms expensive- but hey nothing is cheap in Singapore Food in hotel's restaurants looked outstanding but was rather pricey. However, I think it was probably in line with other hotel restaurants in Singapore & Singapore is much more expensive than the rest of SE Asia. construction next door from new building going up- noise is constant so be sure & ask for rooms on the other side of the building like rooms ending in 09,11. We didn't hear noise from the building construction but rather from a bar outside the hotel where the noise traveled up & we were on the 16th floor! We were told the building construction would go on for another 2-3 years so beware! The General Manager came up to the lounge to talk to some long term guests that we got to know & we were introduced to him. After that, he made a point to say hi & talk for a few minutes to us whenever we saw him. I have never seen a general manager in any Marriott so accessible & visible so this was a pleasure. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fine stay”
Reviews.Author: mukherjeek
Reviews.Content: stay was short, but comfortable, hotel is located in a central place

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive, bad interiors but great location”
Reviews.Author: flamboyant624
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel during New Years, the main reason for the hotel selection was the location. You come out of the hotel and right opposite is Ion Shopping mall (a heaven for shoppers), and just outside is the Orchard MRT (Metro station) and the other stores and malls are just next to the hotel. Awesome location, right in the center of the cit and on Orchard Road. However, the service of the hotel was really slow. They did provide whatver required, but took ages to come and that also after several reminders sometimes. The hotel inetriors and rooms are very ok, like a 3-star. The hotel is quite dated and hence not a great place to stay, esp considering the price. Its very expensive. I would not refer staying there. Its like very expensive with bad interiors and poor service

Reviews.Title: “Average Marriott property”
Reviews.Author: gktravelguru
Reviews.Content: Another average Marriott International property. Excellent location on Orchard road and beautiful buliding. However rooms were small and not well maintained. Typical of what one would expect from a similar Marriott in the US but not comparable to other similar properties in Singapore within the same price range. Stayed only once, was not thrilled so opted to stay at the Grand Hyatt next door for subsequent stays. Decent restaurants - nothing to shout about.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid while building work is going on next door”
Reviews.Author: marting
Reviews.Content: OK, so the location is good, in Orchard Road opposite the Orchard MRT. I checked out of the Mandarin Oriental as the PINGING of the lifts was driving me mad at the weekend in the morning. I asked the receptionist at the Marriott for a quiet room away from lift. OK, so the first room was away form the lifts, but right next to 2 guys with hammer drills - the hotel is slap next to a new tower block going up and the noise will be constant. The hotel is fairly old so the windows let a lot of noise in. TO cut a long story short it took almost an hour (VERY poor service)to find another room, both I was shown was next to lifts with very loud PINGING. The rooms are fairly dated, expect to pay S$26 for internet (wired). One to avoid while the Scotts Road building work continues.

Reviews.Title: “There is a better 5 star hotel around orchard...”
Reviews.Author: yyhhcc
Reviews.Content: I was excited that i've a chance to stay in their club-floor with club lounge access... but it all came into a disappointment... - the room at 17 floor, though I tot it should be a 'club floor' standard with 'club floor' amenities.. but it isn't , it is just as worn out as a 3-4 star room anywhere in the island..Totally disappointed with the room setup.. Like everyone else suggested, this hotel needs a serious renovation.. And pls, imagine the evening deserts you can find in the 'Club lounge' are just a few pieces of cakes, some cookies and nuts, with reasonable range of soft drinks? No, this should not be the standard in Marriott hotel! I could find a better 'Club lounge' in M Hotel Singapore, for example.. So, yes, there are a better 5 star hotel nearby Orchard... And I can recommend you the Hilton for example. I stayed in Hilton for 3 nights during the X'mas week before I pop-over to Marriott to continue the X'mas party due to limited rooms in Hilton.. And I can tell you...Hilton standard room set-up is much modern and neat than you can find in the Marriott 'Club-Floor'! Sorry, will not visit this Hotel again unless major reno is done.. Enjoy folks!

Reviews.Title: “City centre luxury”
Reviews.Author: nomads999
Reviews.Content: We spent a brief one night stopover at the Marriott, which could not have been more centrally located - 10 out of 10 for location. The rooms and service were everything one expects of a top notch Marriott - comfortable,well equipped with all the traveller needs. The in-house chinese restaurant was very good and the staff could not have been more accommodating. You know what you get with a top-end Marriott - its quite predictable but invariably good. If you want to stay in the heart of the shopping district, particularly if you are only on a brief stay in Singapore, and want a no fuss top quality chain hotel, then the Singapoer Mariott is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vanvleetr
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Orchard...can't beat it for location and services.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: janr2
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and clean hotel. Location is excellent (on the crossing of Scotts and Orchard). Small minor is that there's a construction site next to the hotel. If you plan to sleep long, you better ask for a room at the side of Orchard.

Reviews.Title: “City Of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Ajitesh
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my vacation and one place which is still fresh in my memory is Singaporeand I decided to share this experience with everyone. My office left me exhausted and a long break was much needed. Since the trip after marriage (aka Honeymoon) was overdue, we decided to travel to Malaysia. Singapore. It is by far one of the most popular destination in Asia, as people pour in from different part of the world to see this small but dynamic country, Shopping Malls, restaurants and nightlife. Singapore Marriott is one of the best hotels in the city. The Staff was very helpful and the hospitality we got was very impressive. The room rent was very reasonable and has a breathtaking view. Singapore Marriott is close to the Airport and is one of the best hotels in Singapore. The Staff was very helpful and the hospitality we got was very impressive. The room rent was very reasonable and is equipped with Modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and top notch Pool!”
Reviews.Author: TechMarauder
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a Marriott, there are certain things you expect and this hotel delivers. While it is certainly not the cheapest option in Singapore, if you want to be in the middle of it all, but still have a relaxing place to relax by the pool this is it. Once you get here, you can either walk, take a train (right underneath the hotel), or take a bus (right outside is a main bus stop) to anything in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away until construction next door completed and nearby bar closes”
Reviews.Author: Cantilever
Reviews.Content: First, I cannot believe that any review since the construction next door began does not mention the noise. How can it be described? I will do my best to describe it. Constant banging from 8:00 AM until 10:00 PM. (OK they stop for lunch and if it rains then they stop as well). I was on the 26th floor and the construction was 200 feet away. But let me take a step back. I checked in and was given a room on the 22nd floor. We came in the afternoon and as I am traveling with my toddler son he took a nap. I heard the banging but it was not bad this day. I have since learned that on days they are pouring cement the noise is tolerable. But the days they are laying the forms to pour the concrete the banging is horrible. Day one was a cement pouring day. Did I mention the bar. No the bar is not part of the Marriott. It is across the street. As it was a week day the band played until 2:00 AM. Since I was on the 22nd floor I could not believe that I could hear a band playing in a bar next door. More than this I could not believe this was tolerated by the Marriott and the residents of the hotels and residences nearby. Honestly I could hear the words to the songs. Creed, Bon Jovi,. If I were 10 years younger and single this would be great and I would head right down. But I am now married and have a toddler. My toddler woke up at 1:00 from the noise. I am not sure what kind of weird acoustics there are to the building but stay away from the band side. I met a woman staying in a suite on the top floor (30th) and she could hear the music. So I called the front desk at 1:30 and asked about the noise from the band and was informed that tonight was special because they only play until 2:00 AM. On Friday and Saturday they play until 4:00 AM. Can this be true in Singapore where you cannot Jaywalk? Since I found the thought of listening to music until 4:00 AM unimaginable, we switched rooms to face the construction and take our chances with the noise during the day. Breakfast buffet is great. But full or angry people who did not sleep the night before. Yeah, Yeah, great location blah blah blah, subway... I would suggest not staying here until the construction is completed and the Singapore government closes the bar next door. There are plenty of hotels to choose from in Singapore. If you must stay here, Listen closely. Best rooms will end in 12 -15. These face the intersection of Scotts and Orchard and the noise will be limited. If you don’t mind noise from 10:00 PM - 4:00 AM take rooms 08-11. If you do not mind daytime noise until 10:00 PM but nothing until 8:00 AM take rooms 01-07 and above 15. And Bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in the heart of Orchard Road”
Reviews.Author: yoda7416
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the Singapore Marriot for 7 nights in October. We had connecting rooms. Location is excellent, service very good as what would be expected from a top class hotel, food was okay but very pricey. Room quality was very good, with all the usual amenities one would expect or desire, though the rooms are not too large. I would recommend this hotel. It is right in the heart of Orchard, accessible to all forms of public transport.

Reviews.Title: “not up to Mariott standards, but comfy enough”
Reviews.Author: sydboy07
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to get the Marriott Orchard for 120 USD on Priceline earlier this year. For singapore this is a pretty reasonable price. The room is quite large, bed was comfortable, bathroom was in reasonable condition. Checkin and out went smoothly. Perfect location for shopping and gettign around on the MRT. I would say the hotel is not up to the usual Marriott standards. Things seem a bit worn, but everything worked so I was pretty happy. I was on the 9th floor facing Orchard Rd and on the Fri / Sat nights you could hear a lot of music from various advertising screens. It wasn't really that loud that you couldn't sleep. I was out the 2 nights anyways so didn't affect me. The pool is great to lounge around after a hard days walking. For the price I paid I was pretty happy with everything. If you were paying the more 200+ I think then you'd be entitled to feel a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs and a wireless router.”
Reviews.Author: oaklanddave
Reviews.Content: The rooms are noisy, noisy, noisy. I've had to stay a couple times. The last time the construction noise in middle of the night was annoying, and this stay I'm forced to listen to the music blaring from the poolside bar. Even 10 floors above the pool, it's loud. Also the internet is expensive and no wireless in the room. My company books me into this hotel, but next time I'm going to find a way to get another place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if the price is right”
Reviews.Author: maggieMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days through Priceline. Hotels in Singapore are expensive and this was a way to get a 5star for the price of a 3 star hotel. It is a well located property- near shopping, restaurants and the subway. If I were to return, I think I would prefer to stay in the City Hall or Marina Area-- we felt we had to head down that way for all the things to do. Things are expensive, shopping and food more than Hong Kong or China. The rooms are small, and a little worn, but nice and clean. Beds comfortable. We were on the 14th floor on the pool side which was quiet with a very beautiful large window with a gorgeous skyline view. Nice TV with many cable channels, absolutely beautiful uncrowded pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you get a good price. Full price, no.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Marriott but with a great location”
Reviews.Author: barolobrain
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this one short. It's a Marriott and not one of their luxury venues that you sometimes see in Asia. Bog standard which is fine. You're going for consistency. I think it's the first Marriott I've stayed in outside of States and having lived offshore for the past 10 years. Location, excellent, right in the middle of Orchard Road. If shopping's your thing, you can't go wrong here. Check in and check out are quick and other than that, it's average. See my review of the Regent Hotel in Singapore for Singapore visitor tips.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sportbilly121
Reviews.Content: Regretfully the Marriott is my Company's chosen business hotel and given the choice I would not stay there. The location is great, doubt any better in Singapore, the reception staff friendly but that is where the accolades stop. The rest is dire I'm afraid. This is one hotel desperately crying out for an upgrade, major upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel BUT TAKE NOTE OF THIS....”
Reviews.Author: endofcity
Reviews.Content: I would agree with what most people have said about this hotel. It's in a great location, nice staff, nice lobby - all of which you would expect from a decent hotel in Singapore. Once thing to be wary of is since it is an older hotel, some of the rooms have connecting doors, including the one I stayed in. These connecting doors offer little noise insulation from the neighbouring room and I hardly slept the second night, due to a very noisy neighbour. If it hadn't been for that, I would have really enjoyed my stay. MAKE SURE YOU GET A ROOM WITH NO CONNECTING DOOR!!! You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey simply for its name”
Reviews.Author: FussyLilPrincess
Reviews.Content: will rather choose cheaper ones around that area. nothing impressive. staff is not too friendly. only plus point is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LaGlobettroter
Reviews.Content: The location of the Marriott is perfect on Orchard Street. High quality hotel! Nice gym and pool. That was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: shandydog
Reviews.Content: Positive stay with good service. Location is good for dining in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: KimKDallas
Reviews.Content: As long time Marriott business travelers, we stayed at the Singapore Marriott rather than one of the more local hotels when we visited in June. The hotel sits right in the middle of one of the largest shopping areas in Singapore – during the biggest sale of the year, of course. What that meant to us was that the people watching was wonderful. We’d sit in the restaurant for breakfast and watch all kinds of people walk by. The other thing that really stood out was how easily Eastern and Western cultures, dress, languages and food blended in this city. No matter where you were in that spectrum, pretty much everything was accepted. Rooms Beds were very comfy and the temp was easy to control in the room. Room had 2 standard sized twin beds. Bottled water was provided in the room. Rooms and Bathrooms were nice, but small--largely due to the design of the building. Robes, slippers, safes, hair dryers and ironing boards were provided in the room. One note on the safe --- it was in the closet and didn’t seem to be bolted down to anything….. Although we had no issue. In room coffee was ok, although like much of Asia was instant. 2-3 kinds of tea were also available. Not uncommon to have to wait for elevators at all times of the day based on how busy hotel is. Concierge Lounge We were given access to the Executive Lounge on the 27th Floor. Staff service there was wonderful, regardless of time of day. There were coffee, tea, sodas and water available from 6am to midnight. Daily modified continental breakfast was available M-F from 6-10am and 6-11 on weekends and holidays. In addition to a huge selection of breads, cereals and fruits, there were a couple of hot options available each day. Breakfast was excellent and the coffee was really good! Those with Lounge access had the option of taking breakfast in the restaurant as well. Complementary cocktails and hors d’oeuvres were served from 5:30 to 7:30 pm. In some hotels, the evening snacks could serve as a substitute for dinner --- this was definitely one of those places! They had salads, sandwiches, hot items, fruits, cheeses, and desserts. Alcohol was available at other times, but was billed to the room. Desserts and fruits were served until 930 each evening. Free wi-fi, as well as a computer that you could use was also available in the lounge. The staff there was also able to take care of our checkout and offered great suggestions on what to do and how to get around. The lounge was fairly busy during both breakfast and happy hour. Breakfast in the Cafe Buffet breakfast in the café was wonderful! You had the option of sitting indoors or out, and we thoroughly enjoyed the outdoor option. It gives you the opportunity watch the people as the locals are headed off to work. There was a fresh juice station, eggs to order, meats, veggies, local options, fruits, cheeses, cereals, yogurts and a waffle / pancake station with ice cream! Service was wonderful – both tableside and at the various stations around the buffet. I think this was our favorite breakfast experience the entire trip! Transportation From the hotel, you can access the subway stations very easily. Entrance is right next door. We found it easier to use the Singapore Airlines Hop-on, Hop-off bus to see the city. It’s the perfect way to get around to most of the major areas, and if you are making multiple stops, it’s definitely cheaper than cabs. Most of the hotels have brochures / maps and can tell you where the nearest stop is. There was a stop right outside the Marriott on Scott and Orchard Road. Cost was S$12 for adults or S$6 if you had a boarding pass from Singapore airlines. http://siahopon.asiaone.com.sg/ We used the airport shuttle to get to and from the airport for S$9 / person. http://www.visitsingapore.com/publish/stbportal/en/home/getting_around/transportation/airport_shuttle_service.html Also, the shuttle bus out to the night safari, zoo and bird park picks up from the Hyatt next door. Cost of S$4/person each way is cheaper than a cab (depending on number in your party). http://www.bushub.com.sg/additionalContent.asp?ContentID={B8D39D23-A308-4025-8134-CFB5FBFD3D2E} Hotel provided information on all of these. Area There are lots of big malls, little restaurants, pubs, 7-11, drugstores, bookstores, etc. within walking distance. You should be able to find what you want fairly easily without paying hotel prices. On the weekend, it is a popular area with the locals and can be fairly crowded. It’s a great place to people watch. Service Overall, service was top notch. Everyone you saw spoke to you and was very friendly. We were always greeted with a smile. English was VERY common in the hotel. Housekeeping was great, and kept us stocked with bottled water. Room was serviced twice a day. Concierge staff was wonderful. Restaurant staff was fun, friendly and efficient. The front desk staff walked us to our room. Even if a request had to be handed off between staff members at shift change, it was always addressed – nothing was ever dropped. Pool We took some time to enjoy the rooftop pool at the hotel and it was wonderful! One of the oddest parts was realizing that you were on the roof, several floors above the street, and when you look out across the pool umbrellas, you see more skyscrapers! Pool is a pretty blue tile, and like all tile, can be a little slippery when you are in it. There are some fun lounge areas across the back of the pool area, in addition to the regular lounge chairs. It’s an incredibly tranquil place! Hotel was a great choice. It’s very much at the center of the shopping area, and the pagoda design makes it easily identifiable regardless of where you are. I’d definitely go back when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bar One in Basement”
Reviews.Author: pnmehta
Reviews.Content: The Singapore Marriott is not a new experience for me or my family. Superbly located in the heart of Singapore's busy bustling Orchard Road and surrounded by shopping malls of every conceivable size, selling the top brands in the world the hotel is a pleasure to stay in. Friendly and attentive staff, a surprise lounge in the entrance lobby that offers a mouth watering array of cakes & pastries are some fo the things that make this hotel a delight to stay in. However, the popular bar/nightclub in the basement called Bar One is the real treat. Playing live music ranging from local talent to the popular songs it is a fun and rambunctious place where one can let their hair down and enjoy a late night if you have the energy.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull experience for the family”
Reviews.Author: barbs69
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to stay at this hotel since the place we were booked had an ongoing renovation. Since this is the first time we would be travelling to Singapore we wanted to be sure we had a good place to stay. Upon arrival at Marriott, we were pleasantly greeted by the staff and assisted. Azlan, who was at front desk was very informative and helpful. Our family was initially booked in a deluxe room, but we opted to upgrade to a junior suite (rm 2416). We were very happy with the suite as there was a king sized bed. the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was really spacious and clean. We were located a few floors below the lounge which was convenient for my 13 year old and 8 year old to get to. Wi-fi in the lounge was fast. The location of the hotel was central. We were walking distance to wisma, takashimaya and paragon. It was also easy to travel to funan and other places since the hotel was central. Everyone at the hotel was professional and pleasant, from the doorman to the staff at the restaurants and the lounge. After a tired day from touring, it was such a pleasant place to get home to, just like our home.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very expensive, construction noise”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinker2005
Reviews.Content: Nearby construction on two sides makes a lot of noise at the pool and inside some rooms. 5th floor pool gets afternoon sun and has nice food & drink services, without screaming kids. Some rooms are noisy from internal "mystery" sounds (HVAC?) Typical last-generation self-locking slamming doors. Mini-bar and flat-screen TV (pay movies and international channels). wall-to-wall marble in batth, two sinks, seperate tub and shower. Comfortable towels and bedding (soft pillows). Ground floor lounge with snack food, four tap beers ($16 SNG / glass!) and late night (early morning) dancing. Ground floor cafe. Very close to MRT subway stop (Purple Line - Orchard Road). Lots of one-way only access complicates taxi access. Nearby shops and fast-food joints. (McDonalds and Borders). Very helpful and knowledgable Concierge. Expensive Internet access. Overall, very helpful staff, just very expensive due to low value of US dollar. Probably other nearby better values.

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MonikafromSurrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights end of April. We spent here 5 nights last August and were very happy to come back. The location is fairly central and you can go everywhere by taxi for a reasonable fare (£3-£7). The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The concierge really pulled some strings to get us good tickets to The Cats musical on a very short notice. I liked best the breakfast at the Crossroads Cafe downstairs even though we had access to the Executive Lounge. The Lounge access is a great perk as they serve complimentary hot and cold snack and cocktails in the late afternoon. There is also free internet service there and free WiFi. We had a lovely room with a kingsize bed and a massive window. The bathroom had a shower cabin and a separate bath tub as well as 2 sinks. There is quite a bit of construction going on from at least 2 sides of the building. You can hear the noise when you try to relax by the pool. But overall, I will not hesitate to come back again. We had some great lunches at the Suntech City Mall. I love dim sum!! We also got on the Duck Tour which started from there.
