A trip worth a while is the Botanical Gardens and especially the Orchid Garden. Another great place to visit is the Merlion Park as you can see the funky looking Esplenade Centre and many interesting buildings. For a good night out, just go the the Clark Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: runner71
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and although our trip wasn't really leisure we did thouroughly enjoy the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The service is amazing. The pool is fantastic. The fitness center is being renovated but the temporary area was still great! The hotel is in a great location in the middle of all the shopping on Orchard and right above an MRT station that can get you anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FeistyMarmot
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for two weeks while he was in town on business. We had a standard room, which was very comfortable—nice linens, shower w/ very good water pressure (and a good-sized separate bath tub), robes and slippers, mini-fridge, free water and tea everyday. Everyone in the hotel was very welcoming and attentive. I used the business center once to fax some documents, and the staff were helpful and pleasant. We were on the eighteenth floor, and we did occasionally hear the karaoke as others have mentioned (around 9 or 10 PM), but noise from the construction across the street was never an issue. The gym is very clean and well equipped—an excellent selection of cardio equipment and weights—and well stocked with fresh towels and complimentary water bottles. I also thought the pool and spa (steam room, sauna, and jacuzzi) were well maintained and very relaxing. The brunch is excellent, although a bit on the expensive side. Jet-lagged and having no expense account of my own, I found myself searching for a reasonably priced breakfast at 6 AM. I didn’t have much luck on that front, but I did find that the Starbucks in Tanglin opens at 7 AM (weekdays), as does Han’s Café in the Far East Plaza (classic American breakfast of eggs, toast, and bacon). If you can wait until 8 AM, Toastbox in Wisma Atria is a good option (and my personal favorite—grab a seat by the window and watch Singapore wake up). All in all I thought this was a very good place to stay. Even if Orchard Road isn’t your ideal setting (i.e. you’re not an avid consumer of Cartier), the access one has to so many other locales in Singapore via public transport (which is immaculate and efficient) is superb. The hotel sits right on top of the metro, and a number of useful buses (e.g. lines to Bukit Timah, Botanical Gardens, etc.) stop at Tanglin or very close by, allowing for easy (and frugal) exploration of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best of All”
Reviews.Author: ayushpurva
Reviews.Content: I satyed at Marriott Singapore for 2 nights, i checked in for superior room which was good enough. later my wife gave me a surprize by shifting to pool terrace room, we paid some good amount but it was worth it. the room was wonderfull and it was one of the best nights we spent ever. the hotel location is excellent walk away from all the big shopping malls like paragon, takashimaya, atria and mnay more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Marriott because of the location. I am glad we chose this property as it was very good. Caught the MRT from the airport to Orchard station and when we got out, the hotel was just outside which was excellent. Very cheap on the subway too, unlike Sydney (where you pay extra money for substandard trains not designed for luggage/airport users). Staff are excellent and are on the ball. The rooms are modern and nice. Very comfortable 'Revive' bedding. Plush pillowtop beds. When I requested the hotel, I had asked for high floor and extra feather pillows. Both requests given. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: az_travellr
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! We booked 5 nights during the beginning of December 2008, using our Marriott reward points. Our room was small but clean and being on the 21st floor we had a great view of the city. There was construction going on the property next door but we weren’t bothered by it at all… perhaps rooms on other sides of the hotel might have been affected by the construction activity. There is an Executive Lounge on the top floor of the hotel, also with a fabulous view. We took advantage of the Wifi services there and relaxed there in the evening after a day of sightseeing, enjoying the drinks and appetizers that they had to offer. Travellers that have Platinum or Gold memberships have free use of the lounge and can also have breakfast free at the Marriott Café off the lobby. The hotel is in a excellent location, on Orchard Road, which is a major commercial strip – lots of shops, shopping centers, restaurants and other services. You can walk to all of it. We were there just prior to Christmas so the streets were festively decorated and colorfully lit – very beautiful to see. Taxis are available in front of the hotel and access to the Orchard MRT station (train) is located at the base of the hotel… very convenient! The MRT is very easy to use and is a very inexpensive way to get around. Attendants there are very friendly and eager to help. Just a note about visiting Singapore at this time of year… it’s the rainy season. It alternated between sunny and cloudy while we were there so we planned our indoor and outdoor sightseeing accordingly. When it did rain it wasn’t usually a light sprinkle but more of a sudden downpour… so handy to have a compact umbrella tucked in your pocket or bag. The airport is about a 20-25 min drive from the hotel. We had to catch our flight very early in the morning so the attendant at the concierge booked a taxi in advance and it was waiting for us in front of the hotel on the morning of our departure. Overall our stay here was great! The hotel staff were very courteous, responsive to our needs and truly tried to do their best to make our stay a pleasant one. We’d stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel I have ever stayed in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Danyde
Reviews.Content: Rooms need to be renovated! Everything is old an not quite clean. this year I don't go back to rhis hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrssozymc
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be in the thick of it. It's right on Orchard rd so is perfect for shopping. The MRT station is directly underneath which couldn't be more convenient for exploring the city. It is a very busy hotel and the lobby area is always packed so if you're looking for a quite getaway hotel this wouldn't be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but too business like.”
Reviews.Author: zoisite
Reviews.Content: A lovely pagoda shaped building - shame you don't get to see it though as the views from the windows here all seem to be of building sites. A very good hotel but not a holiday feel to it, it really is designed for business travellers. The club lounge facilities are oversold so several times you can go in there with no places left to sit - this is really out of order. They should not sell this and then not have enough space! The outdoor pool was stunning but unusable with the building site directly overlooking with fumes from generators and deafening noise - not relaxing in any shape or form.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Shirls45
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the most fantastic location. Could not ask for a better position. Loved staying in the hotel. Had a lovely room overlooking the pool. The room was a nice size and a great bathroom. Also the most superb breakfast. Could not find any faults with hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: I_Hate_Mushrooms
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Singapore Marriott for 3 nights at the beginning of October. Have to say I have no complaints at all. I booked this stay using my reward points so didnt cost me a penny. Also got access to the exec lounge with free breakfast, drinks between 5.30pm and 7.30pm and desserts until 9.30pm. The lounge does get a little full understandably when the free drinks are available. However the staff in there are great and really look after you. The room is of a normal Marriott standard which is really good and clean. Great views from our room on the 27th floor. Would I stay here again? Most definately. highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to explore Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Lipany
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Marriott for over 1 month and cannot praise enough the hotel. Hotel has the perfect location to explore the city. Right in the centre of the city you can easily reach any place in the city by underground or taxi. The rooms are spacious and cleanliness all around the hotel. If you looking for a chic place this might be not the right choice, but location and overall service are excellent. Staff has been always friendly and efficient. I would definitely recommend anybody to pay the upgrade to executive room as the access to executive lounge its worth it. Located on one of top floors, it has amazing view and nice breakfast buffet and evening canapes are included. The outdoor cafe has great menu and is great spot to have a drink in the evening and observe the buzz around. I definitely would return back if looking for hotel in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Malaysian_suzie
Reviews.Content: Situated on the corner of Orchard and Scotts Road, the Marriot is at a great location in Singapore, especially if one has a few days to shop and enjoy the city. It's 3 mins from the closest MRT Train station which could take you to other locations for shopping. Taxis were plentiful and necessary if you're visiting the sites which are further away from the city center. Service was efficient and up to expected standards. As was the breakfast and housekeeping. One regret was not trying out the pool as it looked fantastic from our room. Overall, would recommend this hotel for an enjoyable stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Singapore Marriott”
Reviews.Author: cap3tt3
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel situated on Orchard Street. It is at the far end of Orchard street so Singapore's other sites like Clark Quay are not with in walking distance. However the Metro is right next to the hotel so it is easy access. We only stayed one night but we were delighted with our treatment. The staff were attentive, helpful and efficient. Our room did not have a great view looking the other way from the city but if you had a room on the city side of the hotel I am sure the view would be nicer (at least until the big building being constructed across the road is completed couldnt say after that). The shopping near by is wonderful we only window shopped but what I saw made want to go back pronto and the Borders shop next to the hotel is one of the biggest I have seen. The buffet was expensive (as they are) but the variety of food was enormous and the quality was delicious. Overall based on one night stay a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: thechinesecockney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights on the 21st level and enjoyed our time at this hotel. The staff are excellent here, and you are made to feel welcome immediately. The hotel is located on Orchard Road next to the MRT station and also 3 or 4 of the major shopping malls. For convenience, you can't really choose a better location. The room is on the small side, but more then adequate for the amount of time you spend in there, and the bathroom is a good size considering the overall dimensions. There was a bath and a separate shower as well as two hand basins. We did have one issue with the room, where the bathroom had not been cleaned by housekeeping, they sent something straightaway after we pointed it out, as well as receiving a apology note and a fruit bowl. The breakfast buffet has a large selection, and would definitely recommend sitting outside and getting to watch the world go past. They also have a good swimming pool with plenty of sun loungers, a great place to cool down from the heat. We tried the Spa Treatments located in the hotel, which were not that great, so wouldn't recommend using them, there are plenty of other establishments in Singapore to choose from. The only other issue we had was the noise, which seem to be worse on Friday and Saturday evening. Not sure if it was from a bar on Orchard Road or at the hotel, but we could hear the music at midnight and we were on the 21st floor. I guess its a trade off for the location. Overall, we would definitely head back to this quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Marriott was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: bruin1971
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Singapore Marriott and wished that we could have spent more time there. Everyone at the Marriott from the reception desk to the porter to the concierge to the maid to the Executive Lounge staff was outstanding and friendly. I had enough Marriott Reward points to have 3 free nights but Brian at the reception desk suggested that I upgrade to the Executive Level for a very reasonable price. I am glad that I accepted his suggestion as the Executive Level room was very nice with a spectacular view of Singapore. The staff at the Exec Lounge were very helpful and friendly. After a day of sightseeing, it was always very pleasant to return to the lounge to enjoy glasses of juice and a light snack. The cocktail time from 5:30 to 7:30 I believe was a nice way to unwind from the day's meandering. The location is right above the Orchard MRT station and it is in the midst of several shopping malls. I highly recommend the hotel and plan to stay there again on my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Living Room Bar”
Reviews.Author: Drynachan
Reviews.Content: Though I haven't stayed in the hotel ( I am staying at another hotel in Singapore for six weeks) I have used the bar many times, recently though my wife and I popped in for a drink and I ordered a diet coke and cranberry juice for my wife, we sat at the bar I and I was served with a glass full of ice and on my first sip of my drink noted that it was flat, I mentioned it tomy wife who said that she had noticed the barman had poured my drink from an already opened can of coke and that since then he had topped another drink from the same can, I called him over and he at first denied it but when I insisted that my wife had watched him he admitted it, a waitress then appeared at his side and he whispered to her, she then spoke to us saying it was a mistake and she offered me a new unopened can which Irefused saying that a mistake had not been made but that the barman had deliberately attempted to defraud me and at that we left the bar and contacted two guest relation managers in the foyer who when I explained the situation were most apologetic and said they would investigate the problem and they took my e-mail address and said they would get back to me soonest, after twodays I had heard nothing so I contacted one of the guest relation managers who expressed surprise that I had heard nothing from the bar manager and that he would get him to get in touch, that was five days ago and still nothing! I was lucky I was sitting at the bar and that my wife had spotted the scam, this is a busy bar with an even busier one on the sidewalk so I hope that what happened to me was a one off otherwise somebody is making money wrongly and the senior hotel management must be unaware that is going on in their five star establishment, as I said to the guest reations this is not the sort of treatment I would expect in a Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nabows
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights on the way home from Australia in July 2008. While I agreed with the other reviewers that the hotel room was small with two double beds, it was fine for my family 2 adults two children as we spend little time in the room. The hotel supplied an additional bed free of charge. The hotel was excellent, very friendly staff, great breakfast (eat outside) and has a fantastic location located at the Tangs department store and the subway on Orchard Road (the main shopping area). This is significant work going on in a site adjacent to the the back of the hotel where my room was (5th floor). There is major construction happening in a lot of Orchard Road and in Senosa island. However none of this disturbed us. Didn't eat (outside of breakfast) in the hotel as there is so much choice in Singapore. Try the food court across the road from the hotel (use the underpass) great, very cheap food. Taxi transfer from the airport (which was very efficient after Australia) was very cheap about 25 to 44 Singapore dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great if using Rewards points”
Reviews.Author: nmrteck
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in the Hotel for 3 nights from June 11 thru June 14th 2008. As with the Holiday Inn Atrium in which we stayed the previous 5 nights, I used my Marriott Reward points for these nights 3 amounting to 78,000. As a Platinum member I received a nice room on the 25th floor, near the Elevator and below the “Concierge Lounge”. The King bedded was functional for two. There was a Flat panel TV and a separate shower/bath. Upon check in I received a choice of Platinum gifts of which I selected chicken and Beef Malaysian Satay with peanut sauce and a bottle of wine which were delivered to my room free of charge. I also had lounge access (which has free wireless). Two bottles of water per day were provided and we used the Mini-bar fridge to store them. There is a safe in the room. The wireless would have cost $25.00 per day but as our room was near the lounge I was able to piggyback onto the free wireless and not have to go to the lounge every time I wanted to surf the web. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Again Being a Platinum member my girlfriend and I received a free breakfast Buffet each day. I believe the list price was about $25 per person. A great deal as the buffet is loaded thus we did not go hungry on our stay. Though there may be better- it reminded me of a Sunday brunch at some US hotels- and for the price it was an excellent. The Lounge also had drinks, bottles of water, juice, and soft drinks. There was a continental breakfast, snacks in the afternoon, and desserts in the evenings- all complementary for Platinum and Executive level service guests. The location was fairly quiet and was directly on Orchard road which is a high volume Shopping area with shops ranging from good value to out of my price range. The MRT station is directly below and one of the reasons we moved from the Holiday Inn Atrium was more access to MRT with less walking and taxis. Lucky Plaza was a mall very near the Hotel and it had very nice and cheap shops for trinkets such as souvenirs and bags, phones, and cameras. However it is not Simlim Plaza. Overall we enjoyed it, especially the free piggybacked internet and the free breakfast buffet. Though I would not pay the price they ask which at the time we were there was about $350-460 per night using points it was well worth it and we will be back there for 5 nights in September, again on points, and again requesting a room near the lounge so I can get the free internet. A note as other reviewers have commented on…There is a large construction project going on and even on the 24th floor we heard it daily even on Saturday. Had I not enjoyed the free internet and been so tired from walking it would have annoyed me in the mornings and I would have asked to move to another room on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, outstanding food”
Reviews.Author: Aurora_Guy
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Singapore Marriott well after midnight one morning in early June. I was dog-tired and a little cranky, but the bellman and check-in clerk changed my feelings 180 degrees. They greeted me like I was long-lost family coming home. Singaporans are famous for their friendly nature, but over four days, the Marriott staff exceeded my expectations with their attentiveness, courtesy, and a willingness to go the extra mile to make sure I had what I needed during my stay. It didn't matter that I was using a Marriott Rewards certificate for my room. They treated me first-class the whole way. About 20-25 minutes from the airport (SGD30-40 taxi fare), this hotel is well located on Orchard Road with plenty of shopping opportunities within a few steps. The Orchard Road MRT (subway) station is down any one of several escalators on the property, too, so the entire cosmopolitan city is wthin easy reach. Whether you long for exploring Little India, a stroll along the Esplanade, or a quick bite in Newton, you can get there in just a few minutes from the Singapore Marriott. The cuisine is excellent, and Crossroads outside is a wonderful place to people-watch and sip a cool drink. The Executive Lounge is very comfortable and large, but it is also very popular in the evenings. Two out of three nights I was unable to find a seat during evening cocktails. Breakfast times were also very crowded. While the lobby, Executive Lounge, and other areas were fine, it was apparent the hotel is in need of some refurbishment. Stains on the carpet, worn paint in the hallways, and dated decorations in my guest room suggest it was top-notch, but time has taken its toll. Indeed, Marriott rates it as a Category 6 hotel, just as the JW Marriott in Hong Kong is, but there is simply no comparison. I don't mean to suggest the Singapore Marriott is a poor property. It really is quite good, but some TLC and a bit of money for updates and minor repairs would bring the facilities up to snuff. I can recommend the Singapore Marriott for both tourists and business travelers. Before you book, though, check to see if there are rate specials.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and OK housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Dentelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 31, 2008 to June 2, 2008 and i'd really say that the experience was wonderful. The best thing I loved about this hotel was that it had a very wonderful and convenient location! Beside this hotel is Tang Plaza and if you just cross the street you can already go to Wisma Atria and Takashimaya. Right now, there's still a new mall that's being built, its name is 'ion' so a stay in this hotel will be promising. The rooms were Ok, the room was just right and four average sized people can fit in it. The bathroom was the part i liked the best about the room. There was a separate shower to the bathtub and there was space for our things and for the clothes we're going to change into. The TV is already flat screen, but the channels mostly consist of foreign (language) channels instead of the local channels. In front of the elevators there were a lot of apples for the guests during our stay, we enjoyed the complimentary apples for the guests. Overall, this hotel is a great place to stay- wonderful rooms in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but ......”
Reviews.Author: atwater5122
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a family of four from April 27 to May 3. We chose Marriot simply because I am a member of their reward program. The hotel is at a superb location, right in the center of the Orchard Road commercial area. It is convenient. The subway, MRT, is within walking distance through the basement of the hotel. The rooms are smaller than many other Marriot hotels because of the polygon shape of the building. Generally speaking, the hotel staff was friendly and well trained as they are seen elsewhere in the world. Only a few problems occured: First, during our stay, for two nights in a row at about the same time around 10:30pm, a fire alarm went off and an in-room loudspeaker started talking announcing that the hotel was checking the cause of the alarm. A few minutes later, the loudspeaker declared that it was a false alarm. Second, from the third day of our stay, I noticed a wet spot in the corner of the room near the bed. I first thought probably the kids dripped some water on the carpet and didn't pay much attention. However, the spot became larger and wetter. Then I figured some pipe must be leaking underneath the carpet. I called the front desk and they changed my room immediately. On the night we moved to the new room, we opened the roll-away sofabed but the kids said it was uncomfortable to sleep in it. I checked and found the mattress was upside down. I turned the mattress over and guess what I found? A big spot of stain. Other than these, those men in black (security? customer service?) in the lobby seem to be very unfamiliar with the local area. I once asked them the location of Orchard Shopping Center which was three blocks away from the hotel, but they gave me the totally opposite directions. Besides, while wireless internet access is available from the first to fifth floor, they charge an obscenely unreasonable price for internet access in guest rooms for both wired and wireless connections. The wireless connection charge per day was almost USD100! For the price I paid, this hotel clearly missed my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive Accommodations and Staff! Book It!”
Reviews.Author: 01ofvisadventures
Reviews.Content: I just cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The location is fantastic for shopping and restaurants and the subway is very close. The rooms are large and stylishly decorated with panorama view windows stretching all the way across the room. Beds are very comfy with all the new Marriott bedding. The pool area is great with big cushy sun beds and umbrellas. There was a large shallow pool area separate from the main pool. Perfect for small children or for laying in to cool off and still catch some sun. I would recommend adding the executive lounge to your package. The staff treats you like family, and we were warmly greeted by name after our first visit. We were served drinks as if we were in a paying establishment. Staff would stop by and chat and ask about our day. The breakfast and evening buffets were plentiful and satisfying enough that we ate there several days and ended up spending nothing for food or drinks. For breakfast there were fresh salmon and bagels, eggs, sausages, pastries, muffins, dim sum, a wide selection of fresh fruits and condiments and crudités. Fresh juices and hot coffee. You also have the option of eating in the indoor/ outdoor buffet for breakfast if you have executive club privileges. Just don't order a mimosa... S25.00 for one! The dinner spreads were equally nice with dim sums, teriyaki chicken, spinach salad with ALL the fixings, quiches, satay, egg rolls~ just fabulous! A nice variety that changed every evening. We would go in for evening cocktails and end up eating so much that we did not need dinner. Top shelf liquors and very nice wines. You could literally eat at the Executive Lounge and not spend any additional money for food for your entire stay. We did eat out several evenings, however, you could easily survive nicely on what is served there. Our concierge Shelly was AMAZING! She went WAAAY above and beyond the call of duty. All of the staff at this hotel is very service oriented and I just have to mention an unusual circumstance. I became worried about a guest traveling with me. He had open heart surgery in August and I got worried as he was complaining of dizziness, heartburn, and his color just did not look right. Shelly made an appointment for me to take him to a specialist, just to be safe. She sent up directions and even had an employee walk us to the best way to exit and point out the hospital to us. She then extended our check out to 5 pm; when we were not back at the expected time she extended it AGAIN until 6 pm AND arranged for us to have executive lounge privileges again that evening after our ordeal. She remembered that we were moving to The Fullerton Hotel for the remainder of our stay. She called us there to inquire if everything went okay as she had gone home before we got back to the hotel! We also left a computer bag with cell phone and various items in the inside/ outside dining area downstairs. They found the computer and delivered it to us at The Fullerton within the hour. Unbelievable! I did agree to offer an unbiased review, so I have to mention that there is construction going on currently right next to the hotel, and you do hear it though it isn't very intrusive or overbearing. If the rest of the hotel had not been so comfortable and the staff so friendly, I may have been a bit aggravated about it. As nice as The Fullerton Hotel is, I must say that I missed The Marriott Orchard after we moved. The lounge is better and they make you feel as if you are a truly valued guest there. Another thumbs up for another wonderful Marriott property!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel needs help with the breakfast service”
Reviews.Author: nitasha
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the hotel for 5 days - a great hotel. Very clean -lovely bathrooms and attentive service except for breakfast. The breakfasts are of a very high standard - you have to try the watermelon juice. Very busy tho and you struggle to order anything outside the menu like hot milk for cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott I have ever stayed at, and I've stayed at 100's”
Reviews.Author: lkaToronto
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough nice things about the Marriott Singapore. It is located in the middle of the 'upscale' district so if you like shopping for luxury items - it's perfect. Staff are ultra friendly and helpful. Management is caring and responsive. Rooms are a little small but exceptionally well appointed. I am a Marriott Platinum member so I used the executive lounge - and it is simply the best lounge I have ever visited. There is a wide variety of snacks, food, drinks, fruit, etc. and a happy hour from 5:30-7:30pm. Staff pamper you beyond any expectation. If you visit the lounge, get to know the chief concierge Rachel. She'll spoil you rotten.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very crowded”
Reviews.Author: thegreatcow1809
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smack in the heart of Orchard Road, in shopping mall land. McD's is on the left, food republic is right across the road in a mall called Wisma Atria. Great place, and lively all day until 10 at night! Great service at the hotel and make sure you book the breafast with your package.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: susmis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and found it to be excellent. It is located on the bustling Orchard Road and right above the MRT station (Orchard Road) which makes it very easy to get to the hotel from the airport and to get out and about in Singapore. The hotel staff were exceptional and the lovely outdoor pool provided welcome relief when the shopping got too much! We were staying in an executive room which included breakfast each morning, cocktails and snacks from 5-7pm and deserts from 7-9pm in the executive lounge on the 27th floor (great views!). The executive lounge is one of the best I've come across and if you wanted to, you could eat dinner there as the evening 'snacks' included plentiful hot and cold food. The bed was exceptionally comfortable (one of the new marriott revive beds) and the facilities in the room included a huge flatscreen television. I would recommend a room on one of the higher floors for a great city view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lots of Issues”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelbuff
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Singapore Marriott during a recent business trip to Singapore. The hotel is well situated, in the midst of the main shopping district in Singapore. The hotel has a relatively spacious lobby, a good business center, and well-appointed rooms. Unfortunately, there were several problems that will ensure that I dont stay there again. First of all, my colleagues and I went for some drinks to the bar/club in the basement. While sipping our drinks and munching on appetizers, we saw cockroaches coming out from the walls. Also, on Friday/Saturday nights, the hotel's bars become quite crowded and busy, and hence take away from the serene, business hotel atmosphere of the rest of the week (as I noticed during my 4 day stay, the crowds can get rowdy very quickly...). The biggest issue I had surrounded an electrical problem in my room. Supposedly, my entire floor lost electricity as a result of a short circuit in my room. The hotel discovered this at 9AM on a Sunday morning and called my room to ask when they could get access for an electrician to check out the problem. I offered access in an hours time, and the electrician showed up in 5 minutes! To make matters worse, he spent over 2 hours in my bathroom attempting to fix the problem. During that time, neither the electrician nor the hotel's customer service dept bothered to ask if they were inconveniencing me in any way. Having stayed at many 5 star hotels in Asia, I was surprised not to receive an apology (at the least) for interrupting my sleep on a Sunday AM, and that too, taking over my bathroom for 2 hours. In all, the Marriott is a good hotel if the other hotels in Singapore are sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in convenient locatoin”
Reviews.Author: jamesjustin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights during my first trip to Singapore. The hotel location on Orchard road makes it convenient to many shopping malls and restaurants. My room was of good size. The flat-panel TV was a little small given the distance to the bed making viewing a little difficult. The room had high speed internet but not wireless. Wireless is available the lobby and meeting room levels (but strangely enough not in the meeting rooms themselves). The staff were quite friendly and helpful though not overly so. If it is your first time to Singapore beware that taxis are difficult to pickup in the evening. During the day taxis are plentiful but at night the taxi lines get long and it is almost impossible to pick one up on the street. It seems most people keep the number of their favorite taxi and call directly when they need transportation. The Marriott is not a real luxury property but I think it is a convenient and solid choice for both business and pleasure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: OwlNewforest
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Singapore as a stopover on our way to Australia. The hotel was in great location, with marvelous service. The buffet breakfast was the best we encountered on a 5 week round the world trip. The hotel is a great belend of modern and ancient (with a tower shaped as a pagoda). Ther is a lovely pool. Overall a great experience - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: HoltED
Reviews.Content: This is where I try to stay each time I go to Singapore. I have stayed at The Sheraton, Hilton, Conrad, and 2 other regional hotel chains that slip my mind. I like this place because to rooms are very comfortable, the buffet is very good, and the location is perfect. The MRT is right in front of the entrance. Lucky Plaza is steps away along with other shopping malls and dining. I never need a taxi after working in Singapore when I stay here. I can relax at the hotel or head out to explore Orchard Rd. The pool is nice and the staff is top notch. Did I mention the nightclub that is very lively on the weekend? Do yourself a favor and stay here when working or visitiing Singapore. They will take good care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kkekert
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this hotel the minute I walked in! It's so beautiful. It also has great architecture. It has all the facilities and you will not get bored at all! It is also located in a fancy street with so much to do. There are so many places to eat around the area. Extremely lively area and such good location. You can't get anything better than this. I'll be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sabyasachi
Reviews.Content: The biggest plus of Marriott Singapore hotel is its location. It's located right at Orchard Road - the main shopping district of Singapore. There is a MRT station right next to the hotel entrance - so connection to the rest of Singapore is quite convenient from this place. Hotel rooms are quite small even in the executive floor. The focus point in the guest-room is the bathroom. It's designed, illuminated and stocked with amenities quite thoughtfully to pamper the guests. Breakfast is great. There is something for everyone's needs. Snacks in the executive lounge are way better than what we generally get anywhere else. Guest service is superb right from the check-in. Every single staff is spirited to help you out with whatever is in their capacity. They make you feel at home at every touchpoint. The concierges desk goes out of the way to help you out with Singapore trip planning even when you are not buying any package from them. I would recommend this hotel to everyone visiting Singapore. If you are not choosing a river-front hotel, you may check this one out.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: RCBoondoggler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in this hotel. I had the room right next to the pool door exit. A little noisy to say the least. Rooms were nice, but nothing special. Some but not all the rooms were updated (nice TVs etc) not mine....Construction in the area made it a little more noisy. Drinks at the hotel bar were horrible. Can't think of the name of the place, but it's around the corner from the elevators. I like being downtown so I could walk to all the places I wanted to go. Check your bill. I was charged for mini bar purchases that I didn't make…….and was billed again a week later for additional purchases. If you get a great room rate, it would be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location....questionable linens!”
Reviews.Author: Indecisive_traveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in August 2006 for our honeymoon. For location, this hotel just cannot be beat. It is right on Orchard Road where all the big-name shopping is. It is also right next to the Orchard Road LRT Station which makes it extremely convenient to travel around the city. The hotel is beautfully designed and the staff are extremely friendly. I would advise against eating at the hotel however, since prices are steep, as is typical for any hotel. Also, given the numerous cheap, delicious and might I add clean places to eat around the hotel, why eat in the hotel? During our stay, we found several stalls outside the hotel that sold mooncakes, curry puffs, and Singapore beef jerky (nothing like the dry tough version in North America...you've got to try it!!), , as well as food courts in the surrounding malls (some were open early enough for breakfast!) We used the gym facilities several times and found it well-equipped with cardio and weight equipment. There is also an outdoor basketball court. The one negative comment I have about the hotel is the cleanliness of the bedding. Maybe due to the extreme heat and humidity of the country (or just our sheer bad luck), I found the pillows reeked of sweat. I'm not kidding. We requested new pillows (since just changing the pillow cases was not enough) which rectified the problem. However, this was not a pleasant discovery, and really suprised us given the fact that this is a quality hotel. In the end, I gave this hotel a 4-star rating because of the beauty and convenience of the hotel, but took away a star because of the bedding.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: ms_obvious
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel that was near public transportation and this is right above the Orchard Road MRT in Singapore. Very easy to get to from the airport MRT. You do need cash to buy a transit card. I think I purchased a card for $3 then added money for transits on it. It was pretty simple to do. I read some of the complaints and some were valid...some not. This is a beautiful hotel with the upgraded Marriott bedding. There is noise during the day because of construction next door. I was gone to meetings during the day so no problem for me. I did grab a bite to eat at the roof top pool grille resturant and could not hear the noise. The gym facilities are typical of Marriott with a combination of cardio and weight training. I asked the desk clerk what were my options since I had a 11pm flight and wanted to shower after the work day. He said I could pay 1/2 a day rate and keep the room until 6pm (which didn't make sense to me since I wanted it to shower and wouldn't get back by 6pm?) Or I could simply check out and they would lock up my luggage. I could shower later at the facilities at the pool or the gym. I decieded to get a gym locker and when I returned for the day cleaned up. Both facilities had showers but I noticed the gym had loads of towels and hair dryers. This avoided me paying for another day or 1/2 day. Internet access available and they will provide power convertors for US electronics.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Mediocre Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GlobalJana
Reviews.Content: The Marriott in Singapore is located in one of the best locations - right on Orchard Road in the heart of the shopping area. The lobby is quite nice and there are several decent restaurants. The rooms at the Marriott are extremely small (for Singapore) and are not that well lit. The gym is somewhat small as well. I would recommend the Shangri-La (on Orange Grove Road) which also have a great location but is much nicer and also has an Asian/cultural feel.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Singapore hotel”
Reviews.Author: Montana Business Man
Reviews.Content: I really disagree with the low rating this hotel has. I love it and here's why: 1. The location. When I book a hotel room in a major city, my top priority is to be right on top of a subway entrance. If I'm only in town for a few days, I don't want to waste a couple hours each day on walking from hotel to the subway/train terminals. The Marriott is right on top of the Orchard exit, right smack in the middle of all the Orchard Street excitement. You simply couldn't ask for a better location in Singapore. 2. The service is fantastic. I've found everyone from the desk clerks to the bellmen to the fitness club employees to be intensely focused on delivering excellent service. 3. It has an excellent fitness club that is attached to the spa facility. After working out, you can walk across the hall to the spa area to take a shower, sit in the hot tub, sauna, steam room, and a full variety of toiletries. There is some construction going on next door, so the noise is very bad for rooms ending with 06, 07, 08., 09, and 10. The best rooms to get are 12. 13, 14, and 15. The rooms ending with 15, by the way, seem to have the best views down Orchard Street. I've stayed at a half dozen luxury hotels in Singapore and I wouldn't consider anyplace but the Marriott because of its premier location for both shopping and subway access.
